	investing in order to transform the &#147;Silk Road&#148; into a &#147;Fiber Road&#148; by expanding our own infrastructure across Turkey with a fiber network stretching to every corner of the country.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We believe that Turkcell Superonline differentiates itself through its steadfast commitment to the quality of after-sale services. Turkcell
	Superonline supplies corporations with industry-leading service-level agreements utilizing its professional technical support personnel and highly qualified team of consultants. Turkcell Superonline has been awarded the ISO 9001:2000&nbsp;Quality
	Management System Certificate. Turkcell Superonline aims to become one&nbsp;of the &#147;leading innovative telecommunications operators&#148; in Turkey and it intends to continue to seize opportunities in the internet and telecommunications
	markets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Turkcell Superonline won the tender of BOTAS, Turkey&#146;s state-owned pipeline company, for the indefeasible right to use the
	capacity of the fiber optic cables already installed by BOTAS for 15&nbsp;years in 2009, including the right to install additional fiber optic cables and the right to use the capacity of these fiber optic cables during the same period. This
	transaction has been considered as a finance lease as the lease term is for the major part&nbsp;of the remaining useful life of the fiber optic cables already installed by BOTAS and Turkcell Superonline made a significant investment during the
	initial period of the lease agreement which is an indicator that the transaction is a finance lease. The recognized cost of the indefeasible right of use as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015&nbsp;is TRY42.2&nbsp;million. (December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014:
	TRY 42.2&nbsp;million).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Turkcell Superonline began to provide 1000&nbsp;Mbps service to homes in May&nbsp;2011&nbsp;for the first time in
	Turkey in line with the Turkcell Group&#146;s strategy to provide state-of-the-art technology for its customers with top-quality service. Turkcell Superonline has rendered Turkey one&nbsp;of the first five&nbsp;countries in the world where a
	1000&nbsp;Mbps connection is provided to homes thanks to this service option. Turkcell Superonline is the market leader and has 899&nbsp;thousand fiber customers as of December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On August&nbsp;12, 2011, Turkcell Superonline signed a share purchase agreement to acquire a 100% stake in Global Iletisim, which is
	specialized in providing internet and telecommunications services. In November&nbsp;2011, the control over Global Iletisim was acquired from Yildiz Holding A.S. for a consideration of TRY(0.8)&nbsp;million. Turkcell Superonline and Global Iletisim
	merged on March&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2012.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On March&nbsp;7,&nbsp;2013, Turkcell Superonline signed a share purchase agreement to acquire a 100%
	stake in Deksarnet Telekomunikasyon A.S. (&#147;Deksarnet&#148;) which is an affiliate of Vestel Elektronik San. ve Tic. A.S. Group. In July&nbsp;2013, the control over Deksarnet was acquired from Vestel Elektronik San. ve Tic. A.S. Group for a
	consideration of TRY 3.4 million. Turkcell Superonline and Deksarnet merged on December&nbsp;3,&nbsp;2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">

<A NAME="eolPage51"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014, Turkcell Superonline signed a share purchase agreement to acquire
	a 100% stake in Metronet Iletisim Teknoloji A.S. (&#147;Metronet&#148;). In April&nbsp;2014, the control over Metronet was acquired from Es Mali Yatirim ve Danismanlik. A.S. for a consideration of TRY 27&nbsp;million. Turkcell Superonline and
	Metronet merged on July&nbsp;4, 2014. With this acquisition, Turkcell Superonline&#146;s fiber in-city coverage increased to 14&nbsp;cities, up from the existing 12.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015, Turkcell Superonline has 35,269 km of fiber backbone covering 77 major cities in Turkey and has 11 border
	crossings. Turkcell Superonline has fiber in-city coverage in 15 cities and increased its homepasses to around 2.4&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 from around 2.1&nbsp;million a&nbsp;year ago. We have five border crossings to Europe,
	offering various diversity options to important European cities through protected and completely diverse routes. With our stable fiber infrastructure and six border crossings to the East, we offer capacity services through Middle-East, CIS and Asia.
	Our next generation network designed over this strong infrastructure enables us to deliver high quality solutions to telecom operators, multinational and national private corporations and the governmental institutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	With the target of transforming Silk Road into Fiber Road, Turkcell Superonline cooperates with over 70 international operators and takes
	important steps for evolving Istanbul into the world&#146;s newest internet base due to its geostrategic location. Accordingly, we provide a bridge between East and West, which supplies a continuous connection with a speed of light, by partnering
	with the Tier-1 operators and projects such as RCN between Asia, Middle East and Europe which will extend from the city of Fujairah in the United Arab Emirates to Istanbul in Turkey and then to Europe and will serve as a gateway to the Internet for
	2 billion people. In the scope of the RCN project, Turkcell Superonline is represented as a member of the Procurement Group Subcommittee as Chairman of the Operational and Maintenance Subcommittee. Six operators are involved in this project: Syria
	Telecom, Zain and Orange from Jordan, Mobily from the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Etisalat-United Arab Emirates and Turkcell Superonline. The project is operating in the Jordan, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and United Arab Emirates segments only.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Turkcell Superonline aims to continue to invest in and expand its own fiber optic network and further utilize the group synergy created with
	Turkcell. The Company&nbsp;intends to continue to take advantage of business opportunities within the broadband industry in&nbsp;2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Global Tower
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Global Tower, founded in 2006, is a wholly owned subsidiary of Turkcell and the leading technology infrastructure operator in Turkey.
	Its 100% owned subsidiary in Ukraine, UkrTower, was founded in 2009. With the vision of &#147;Carrying Communication Everywhere&#148;, Global Tower rented, built and leased towers for Telecom Operators and TV&nbsp;and&nbsp;Radio Broadcasters in
	Turkey and Ukraine. Today, Global Tower&#146;s core business consists of renting from landlords, selling electronic equipment, installation, implementation, maintenance, tower and rooftop site leasing. Global Tower serves diverse markets including
	telecommunications, TV&nbsp;and&nbsp;radio broadcasting and providing technology services. The main goal of Global Tower in targeted markets is to increase cost efficiency by sharing sites and services. Global Tower&#146;s site sharing business
	model eliminates the initial investment costs of its clients, decreases environmental impacts and promotes efficient use of resources. Many of the most famous radio and TV channels of Turkey have placed their transmitters on Global Tower sites. In
	2015 Global Tower has started providing end to end service to TV and radio broadcasters mainly to leading national radios among all Turkish cities. End to end service consists of tower and system room leasing, electronic broadcasting system
	maintenance and providing broadcasting equipment. Besides Telecom Networks, SCADA/Telemetry Networks implementation and maintenance are in Global Tower&#146;s scope. From the day it was established, Global Tower has achieved a rapid and persistent
	growth and aims to continue its growth by providing high-quality and efficient services.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Turkcell Teknoloji
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Turkcell Teknoloji, a wholly owned subsidiary of Turkcell, commenced operations in 2007&nbsp;in the TUBITAK Marmara Research Center
	Technological Free Zone&nbsp;in Kocaeli, Turkey. In&nbsp;2015, Turkcell Teknoloji consolidated its operations in Kucukyali Technology Plaza, Maltepe, Istanbul, Turkey. Turkcell Teknoloji&#146;s new R&amp;D center employs 678&nbsp;researchers
	(excluding part-time employees) who have been accredited by the Ministry of Science, Technology and Industry. Turkcell Teknoloji&#146;s established team of experts develops a wide range of convenient and reliable solutions with innovative roadmaps.
	Through integrated intelligence and high-performance core capabilities, (Big Data Analytics, SIM, Network, IoT), Turkcell Teknoloji&#146;s comprehensive portfolio addresses the following domains: SIM asset and services management, location-based
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	48
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage52"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	services, new generation value-added services, roaming solutions, big data processing, business intelligence applications, CRM solutions, sales force solutions, network management, mobile
	finance, terminal applications, cloud solutions, mobile marketing, machine-to-machine communication platforms, revenue management solutions and campaign management solutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Turkcell Teknoloji has been continuing to export technology and software to CIS, Europe, Middle East and Africa. The Turkcell Teknoloji
	Campaign Management System is deployed and used in six&nbsp;countries and Roaming Solutions is used in 10 countries. In 2015, Turkcell Technoloji implemented its roaming solutions in Almadar, Libya and delivered many change requests, which means
	additional development for existing products, to its customer base which are spread out in 13 countries.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To ensure a permanent
	competitive edge and value for its solutions, Turkcell Teknoloji cooperates with a wide network of national and international R&amp;D companies, universities and research centers and plays an active role in international R&amp;D programs. With the
	goal of being Turkey&#146;s leading R&amp;D and innovation base, Turkcell Teknoloji demonstrates the value it attached to innovation with its increasing number of patents each year. In 2015, the Turkcell Teknoloji R&amp;D Center submitted over 145
	new national patent applications. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, Turkcell Teknoloji has 513 national and 56 international patents applications and 145 granted patents. Turkcell Teknoloji&#146;s IPR performance is among the top three in Turkey and it
	has over 30 TUBITAK (The Scientific and Technological Research Council of Turkey) supported projects, of which seven are currently running.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Turkcell
	Finansman A.&#350;.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Turkcell Finansman A.&#350;. (&#147;Turkcell Finansman&#148;), a wholly owned subsidiary of Turkcell, was
	established on October 22, 2015 with the approval of the Banking Regulation and Supervision Agency (&#147;BRSA&#148;-financial institutions regulator in Turkey) in order to provide financial solutions to its customers such as consumer loans. The
	company has commenced its operations in February 2016 after receiving BRSA&#146;s operational permission.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Turkcell Finansman is aiming to
	provide effective financing solutions to its customers with a prudent risk management within the scope of the regulatory legislations. To ensure a permanent competitive edge and value for its solutions, Turkcell Finansman cooperates with a wide
	network of Turkcell point-of-sales.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Equity Accounted Investments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(i) Fintur
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Turkcell holds a 41.45%
	stake in Fintur which holds interests in mobile operations in Azerbaijan, Georgia, Kazakhstan and Moldova.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	TeliaSonera, which is one of
	our major shareholders and also our partner in Fintur through a 58.55% stake, announced on September 17, 2015 that it had initiated a process in relation to its Eurasian assets with the ultimate aim of a complete exit. In line with our growth
	strategy in the region, and as the minority shareholder in Fintur (which includes assets in Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Georgia and Moldova), we appointed strategic and financial advisors in order to explore our strategic options to acquire the
	remaining stake in Fintur. On February 26, 2016, we submitted a binding offer for the remaining 58.55% stake of Sonera Holding B.V in Fintur that we do not own and TeliaSonera&#146;s 24% direct stake in Kcell operating in Kazakhstan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Below is a description of the businesses currently held by Fintur.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Azercell
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fintur indirectly owns
	51.3% of Azercell Telekom B.M. (&#147;Azercell&#148;), which offers GSM services on both a prepaid and a postpaid basis in Azerbaijan. As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015, Azercell had approximately 4.1&nbsp;million subscribers, of which approximately
	0.5&nbsp;million were postpaid and approximately 3.6&nbsp;million were prepaid.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The agreement for the privatization of the Republic of
	Azerbaijan&#146;s 35.7% ownership in Azercell was signed in February&nbsp;2008&nbsp;and Azertel A.S., the parent company of Azercell, acquired the Republic of Azerbaijan&#146;s entire stake. Azertel&#146;s ownership in Azercell increased to 100%;
	however, Fintur&#146;s effective ownership in Azercell remains at 51.3%. Azercell was granted a 3G license in the fourth&nbsp;quarter of 2011&nbsp;and a 4G license in the second&nbsp;quarter of&nbsp;2012.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
