	As of August 2015, Consumer and Corporate Business functions are transformed into Sales, Marketing and Customer Services functions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	9
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	As of August 2015, Consumer and Corporate Business functions are transformed into Sales, Marketing and Customer Services functions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	10
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	As of January 2014, the Technology Group function has been established and Information &amp; Communication Technologies, Network Technologies, Products &amp; Services, and Global Tower functions report directly to the
	Chief Technology Officer.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	11
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	As of August 2015, main functions of Turkcell Superonline such as Sales, Marketing, Network and Technology are centralized under Turkcell related functions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	12
</SUP>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Others include the following subsidiaries: Inteltek Internet Teknoloji Yatirim ve Danismanlik Ticaret A.S., Global Tower, Ukrtower, Azerinteltek and Turkcell Satis ve Dagitim A.S., Turkcell Odeme Hizmetleri and
	Lifetech.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We remain confident that high levels of subscriber satisfaction will be possible with continued investment in our
	people. To that end we continue to strive to attract the best talent in the market.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We are able to recruit highly qualified employees due
	to our leader position in the Turkish mobile communication market and our strong corporate identity. Stringent hiring and training standards have resulted in a professional organization with high-caliber employees within a challenging workplace.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	With regard to employee compensation and benefits, the major principles of our policy are to preserve internal equity and external
	competitiveness and reflect individual performance in compensation packages.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Significant factors involved in the process of determining
	compensation and benefits for our employees are our grading structure (based on the Hay Grading system), market movement data and individual performance. We make salary adjustments once&nbsp;yearly. Principal factors in salary adjustments are market
	movements and economic indicators (e.g., the rate of inflation). We pay performance bonuses&nbsp;quarterly to sales employees and annually to all other employees in accordance with individual and company performance results. Our performance
	evaluation system evaluates the whole&nbsp;year performance of our employees through target setting-based on strategic objectives and 360-degree evaluation. Benefits packages are designed in line with the local market practice and linked to grade
	bands/levels where the benefits package improves as the grade band/level increases. We run a flexible benefits plan that allows our employees to select from a pool of choices that suit them such as several shopping and travel vouchers, allowance for
	children and payment to the Defined Contribution Plan (the &#147;DCP&#148;). The DCP is a voluntary pension system in which we and the employee make equal contributions. After a vesting period of three&nbsp;years, the employee gets ownership of the
	contribution we made. The DCP covers all employees who have been working with us for a minimum of six&nbsp;months. As of 2016, a long-term incentive plan will be offered to the management of Turkcell and group companies. The long-term incentive plan
	is subject to company performance measures and linked to our share price performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Each of our employees undergoes an orientation
	program incorporating classroom training and e-learning training. The training provides employees with information concerning corporate culture and ethics, an introduction to our services, basic mobile communications knowledge and functions of
	departments. Each employee has the opportunity to participate in the individual, organizational, functional and managerial development programs after regular analyses of his or her training needs. In addition, each employee receives specific
	training for his or her particular job.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our employees are not members of any union, and there is no collective bargaining agreement with
	our employees. We have not experienced any work stoppages.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_27">
</A>
	6.E Share Ownership
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on reporting made to us in March&nbsp;2016, we believe that the aggregate amount of&nbsp;shares owned by our Board members and senior
	officers at such time was 6,650&nbsp;ordinary&nbsp;shares. No individual Board member or senior officer owned 1% or more of our outstanding&nbsp;shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	103
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	On April&nbsp;29, 2005, the General Assembly approved a revaluation of our ordinary&nbsp;shares from TL 1,000&nbsp;to TRY&nbsp;1. The revaluation resulted in the formation of fractional&nbsp;shares, which have not yet
	been merged into whole ordinary&nbsp;shares. Therefore, we give the nominal value of the ordinary&nbsp;shares owned rather than the units or fractional units thereof.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Controlled by TeliaSonera. On September&nbsp;11, 2009, Sonera Holding, B.V. entered into a derivative transaction with Citibank,&nbsp;N.A. that was settled on October&nbsp;30, 2009, resulting in Sonera Holding&#146;s
	acquisition of 6,418,710&nbsp;of Turkcell&#146;s ADS (representing 16,046,775&nbsp;shares) at a price of $17.30&nbsp;per ADS.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Controlled directly by Cukurova Telecom Holdings Limited that owns 52.91% of its&nbsp;shares. 51% of Cukurova Telecom Holdings Limited&#146;s&nbsp;shares are controlled by Cukurova Finance International Limited and 49%
	are controlled by Alfa Telecom Turkey Limited. For more information, see footnote 4&nbsp;below and &#147;Item&nbsp;3.D&#151;Risk Factors&#151;Turkcell&#146;s complex ownership structure and ongoing disagreements among our main shareholders have
	adversely impacted and may continue to impact decision-making on important matters. These ongoing disputes may lead to further regulatory or legal actions, and affect the ownership and control of our&nbsp;shares&#148;.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	We calculate&nbsp;shares publicly held by deducting from total&nbsp;shares outstanding those shareholders named above. However, a different level of&nbsp;shares publicly held is arrived at when calculating according to
	Turkish regulations, see Free Float Definition Rules&nbsp;in &#147;Item&nbsp;10.B. Memorandum and Articles&nbsp;of Association&#151;Capital Structure&#151;Free Float Definition Rules&#148;. Based on public filings of TeliaSonera, we understand that
	approximately 0.94% of the&nbsp;shares they own in our Company&nbsp;is a part&nbsp;of float, which is in addition to 13.07% of our shares (for a total of 14.02%) held by Sonera Holding B.V., which is controlled by TeliaSonera (see footnote 2).
	According to an announcement made by Lazard Asset Management on Borsa Istanbul&#146;s Public Disclosure Platform on January 13, 2015, it currently holds 5.24% of our publicly held shares.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of March&nbsp;10,&nbsp;2016, Turkcell had 65,691,198 ADRs outstanding held by 49&nbsp;registered ADR holders. To the best of our knowledge,
	as of December 31, 2015, in accordance with the loan agreements signed between our shareholders and various banks, 0.05% of&nbsp;shares having a nominal value of TRY&nbsp;995,509.429&nbsp;have been pledged by our shareholders as security in favor of
	such banks.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Muflis Bilka Kaynak Iletisim San ve Tic. A.S. completed the sale of its 137,199.575&nbsp;shares in our Company&nbsp;through
	the Central Registry Agency as of March&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2012. These&nbsp;shares are now classified as publicly held&nbsp;shares of the Company&nbsp;and Muflis Bilka is therefore no longer listed as an ordinary shareholder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&nbsp;25,&nbsp;2013, MV Holding registered 26,021,712.590&nbsp;shares through the Central Registry Agency. These&nbsp;shares are now
	classified as publicly held&nbsp;shares of the Company&nbsp;and MV Holding is therefore no longer listed as an ordinary shareholder.
</P>

	&nbsp;

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_30">
</A>
	7.B Related Party Transactions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have entered into agreements with our executive officers and with several of our current and former shareholders or affiliates of
	shareholders. We believe that all of such agreements are on terms that are comparable to those that would be available in transactions with unrelated parties. Our policy is to seek price quotes for services and goods we purchase and select the most
	favorable price. Additionally, our Board has adopted the &#147;Rules to be Applied to Related Parties in Purchasing/Selling Assets and Services along with Transfers of Liabilities&#148; to be applied by the relevant employees within the company and
	its group companies on November&nbsp;22, 2014. For a discussion of our Related Party Transactions for fiscal&nbsp;year&nbsp;2015, see Note 35&nbsp;to our Consolidated Financial Statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_31">
</A>
	7.C Interests of Experts and Counsel
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Not Applicable.
</P>

<EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_DATA"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_32">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;8.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	FINANCIAL INFORMATION
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_33">
</A>
	8.A Consolidated Statements and Other Financial
	Information
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Audited Consolidated Financial Statements as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and&nbsp;2014 and 2013, and for each of
	the&nbsp;years in the three-year period ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015, are included in &#147;Item&nbsp;18. Financial Statements&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Company&#146;s Board of Directors decided to appoint Basaran Nas Bagimsiz Denetim ve Serbest Muhasebeci Mali Musavirlik A.S.
	(PricewaterhouseCoopers) as the independent audit firm to audit our accounts and operations for the year 2016. The decision will be submitted to the approval of our shareholders at the next Annual General Assembly Meeting of our Company.
</P>
<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	I. Legal Proceedings
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For a discussion of
	the various claims and legal actions in which we are involved, see Note&nbsp;34&nbsp;(Commitments and Contingencies) to our Consolidated Financial Statements in this Form&nbsp;20-F.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	II. Dividend Policy
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On March 26, 2015,
	the Ordinary General Assembly of Shareholders approved a dividend distribution for the years ended December 31, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 amounting to TRY 3,925.0 million (equivalent to $1,535.9 million as of March 26, 2015), which represented
	42.5% of distributable net income for the relevant years. The dividend was paid on April 6, April&nbsp;8 and April 13, 2015 to shareholders, and was funded from cash on hand that we had accrued in light of our inability to receive approvals to pay
	dividends in prior periods.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have adopted a dividend policy, which is included in our Corporate Governance Guidelines. As adopted, our
	general dividend policy is to pay dividends to shareholders with due regard to trends in our operating performance, financial condition and other factors. Since 2004, the Board of Directors has endeavored to distribute cash dividends of at least 50%
	of our distributable net profits per fiscal&nbsp;year, although the payment of dividends remains subject to our cash flow requirements, applicable Turkish laws and the approval of, or amendment by, the Board of Directors and the General Assembly of
	Shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In order to comply with the Capital Markets Board&#146;s Communiqu&eacute; on Dividends II-19.1&nbsp;dated
	January&nbsp;23,&nbsp;2014, the Turkcell Board of Directors amended its dividend distribution policy proposal in February 2014, as stated below, which was approved by the Ordinary General Assembly held on March 26, 2015:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	&#147;The Company&nbsp;shall target a dividend payout of at least 50% of its distributable net income as cash. This policy will be subject to the
	Company&#146;s cash projections, business outlook, investment plans and capital market conditions. The actual dividend decision will be made for each fiscal&nbsp;year separately with the approval of the General Assembly of Shareholders. Dividend
	distribution shall be started on a date to be determined by the General Assembly of Shareholders which shall not be later than the end of the&nbsp;year in which the General Assembly convenes. The Company, in accordance with laws and regulations, may
	consider distributing advance dividends or making the dividend payment in equal or unequal installments.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Additionally, in order to create added
	value for its shareholders, the Company&nbsp;may also consider share repurchase programs depending on the conditions set forth above and applicable regulation.&#148;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	105
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage109"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accordance with Turkish law, the distribution of profits and the payment of an annual dividend
	with respect to the preceding financial&nbsp;year are subject to a recommendation which may be made by the Board of Directors each&nbsp;year for approval by the shareholders at the annual general assembly. The Board may decide whether or not to
	recommend a distribution of profits together with the amount of dividends, and the shareholders, through the general assembly, may accept, amend or reject such proposal, if any. Dividends are payable on a date proposed by the Board of Directors and
	determined at the general assembly of shareholders, which date, under the CMB requirements, must be earlier than the end of the financial&nbsp;year in which the general assembly decides on dividend distribution. However, the CMB is authorized to
	designate another deadline for distribution of dividends in any given&nbsp;year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Annual profits are calculated and distributed in
	accordance with our Articles&nbsp;of Association after deduction from our annual revenues of all expenses, depreciation, taxes, required reserves and any losses from the previous&nbsp;years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Pursuant to CMB regulations, dividend distributions of publicly held companies are regulated as follows.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	From the distributable net dividend calculated as per the CMB&#146;s regulations, the entire amount calculated according to the CMB
	regulations&nbsp;regarding the requirement of minimum dividend distribution shall be distributed in the event such amount can be covered by the distributable net dividend in the statutory records. In the event the entire amount cannot be covered by
	the distributable net dividend in the statutory records, the total distributable net dividend in the statutory records shall be distributed. In the event there is net loss in the financial statements prepared as per the CMB regulations&nbsp;or
	statutory records, there shall be no dividend distribution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The new Capital Markets Law, which came into force on
	December&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2012, stipulates that public companies shall distribute dividends in line with their dividend policy determined by their general assembly and in conformity with the relevant legislation. However, the new law entitles the Board
	to regulate dividends. The CMB also published a Communiqu&eacute; on Dividends (II-19.1)&nbsp;on January&nbsp;23,&nbsp;2014&nbsp;and entered into force on February&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2014. Within the scope of the Communiqu&eacute;, companies shall
	distribute dividends through a general assembly resolution in accordance with current legislation and the policies of the company. As per the Communiqu&eacute;, dividends may be distributed in installments in case a general assembly resolution is
	adopted in this regard. The Communiqu&eacute; also sets out the principles and procedures for the distribution of dividends. This new Communiqu&eacute; revoked the Communiqu&eacute; on the Principles Regarding the Distribution of Dividends and
	Interim Dividends to be Followed by Publicly Held Joint Stock Companies&nbsp;subject to the Capital Markets Law Serial: IV No: 27, dated November&nbsp;13, 2001.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To the extent we declare dividends in the future, we will pay those dividends in Turkish Lira. In the case of ordinary&nbsp;shares held in the
	form&nbsp;of ADSs, dividends will be converted into U.S.&nbsp;Dollars by the depositary for the ADSs, to the extent it can do so on a reasonable basis, and will be distributed to the holders of the ADSs.&nbsp;Because exchange rates between the
	Turkish Lira and the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar fluctuate continuously, a holder of ADSs&nbsp;will be subject to currency fluctuation generally, but particularly between the date on which dividends are declared and the date dividends are paid. Under current
	Turkish regulations, dividends or other distributions paid in respect of the ordinary&nbsp;shares or ADSs generally will be subject to withholding taxes. See &#147;Item&nbsp;10E.&nbsp;Taxation&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_34">
</A>
	8.B Significant Changes
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Not applicable.
</P>
</EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_LISTING>
<A NAME="FIS_LISTING"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_35">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;9.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	THE OFFER AND LISTING
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_36">
</A>
	9.A Offer and Listing Details
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our capital consists of ordinary&nbsp;shares. Pursuant to an amendment in Turkish Capital Markets Law and a communiqu&eacute; issued by the
	CMB, our&nbsp;shares traded on the Borsa Istanbul were dematerialized as of November&nbsp;2005. For detailed information on the dematerialization of our&nbsp;shares, see &#147;Item&nbsp;10.B. Memorandum and Articles&nbsp;of Association&#151;Transfer
	of Shares&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our ordinary&nbsp;shares are traded on the Borsa Istanbul under the symbol &#147;TCELL&#148; and our ADSs are traded on
	the NYSE under the symbol &#147;TKC&#148;. Currently two&nbsp;ADSs represent five&nbsp;of our ordinary&nbsp;shares. Our ADSs are evidenced by American Depositary Receipts (&#147;ADRs&#148;). On July&nbsp;6, 2011, we signed an amended and restated
	Deposit Agreement (the &#147;Deposit Agreement&#148;) with Citibank N.A. (&#147;Citibank&#148;), as depositary (the &#147;Depositary&#148;), Turkcell and holders of ADRs, which transferred our ADR program from JPMorgan Chase Bank to Citibank.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	106
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage110"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since January&nbsp;1, 2006, capital gains realized without meeting a one-year holding period are
	subject to a withholding tax in Turkey. On July&nbsp;7, 2006, a provision was added to article&nbsp;1/a of Code 5527&nbsp;stating that foreign-based taxpayers, natural persons and corporations are subject to 0% tax. See &#147;Item&nbsp;10.E.
	Taxation&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The table below sets forth, for the periods indicated, the reported high and low closing quotations (as extracted from
	Bloomberg) on the NYSE and the Borsa Istanbul. All quotations have been adjusted to take into account all dividends we have issued in the form&nbsp;of&nbsp;shares and cash.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Second Quarter
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fluctuations in the exchange rate between the Turkish Lira and the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar will affect any
	comparisons of ordinary share prices and ADS prices.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On March&nbsp;10,&nbsp;2016, the closing price per ordinary share on the Borsa
	Istanbul was TRY&nbsp;11.58 and per ADS on the NYSE was $9.99. The Depositary confirmed that we had 66,963,834 ADRs outstanding as of the close of business on December 31, 2015. We had 65,691,198&nbsp;ADRs outstanding as of the close of business
	March&nbsp;10,&nbsp;2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_37">
</A>
	9.B Plan of Distribution
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Not applicable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_38">
</A>
	9.C Markets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our ADSs are traded on the NYSE under the symbol &#147;TKC&#148; and our ordinary&nbsp;shares are traded on the Borsa Istanbul under the symbol
	&#147;TCELL&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_39">
</A>
	9.D Selling Shareholders
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Not applicable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_40">
</A>
	9.E Dilution
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Not applicable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	9.F Expenses of the Issue
</B>
</P>
