	NO
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ROWSPAN="2" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	C
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ROWSPAN="2" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	Below 10
<BR>
	Million
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	YES
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Continuous
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Auction
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ROWSPAN="2" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	NO
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ROWSPAN="2" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	100%
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ROWSPAN="2" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:8PT">
	NO
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	NO
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Uniform
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Price
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the latest CMB decision, Turkcell is listed under Group A companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	i.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Protection of Minority Shareholders
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under Turkish securities law, minority shareholders, defined as those who hold 5% or more of our share capital, have the right, among other
	things, to request our Board of Directors to:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	invite the shareholders to an extraordinary general assembly;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	request that a matter be included on the agenda at both ordinary and extraordinary general assembly;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	request the appointment of special auditors; if the general assembly rejects this request, minority shareholders may apply to the court for the appointment of a special auditor;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	take action against Board members who have violated the Turkish Commercial Code or the articles&nbsp;of association of a company or who have otherwise failed to perform&nbsp;their duties;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	pursuant to the TCC, provided there is a good reason, minority shareholders may claim from the competent court to rule&nbsp;in favor of dissolution of the Company; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	if provided by the Articles&nbsp;of Association of the Company, certain minority groups may be represented at the Board of Directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the new Capital Markets Law, in the event a shareholder votes against a material transaction in a general assembly meeting, as
	briefly described above, such shareholder obtains a right to exit from the company by selling his/her&nbsp;shares. If the shareholder uses that right, the company is required to purchase the shareholder&#146;s&nbsp;shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	j.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Liquidation
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In
	the event of liquidation, our shareholders are entitled to participate in any surplus in proportion to their shareholdings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	k.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Changes in
	Capital Structure
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any increase in our Company&#146;s registered capital ceiling requires an amendment to our
	Articles&nbsp;of Association and therefore shareholder approval through a general assembly. Such amendment is subject to the prior approval of the Ministry of Customs and Trade and the CMB. Our Board of Directors may also restrict the rights of
	existing shareholders and offer new&nbsp;shares to third parties. Changes in the voting and dividend rights of our shareholders require an amendment to our Articles&nbsp;of Association and approval by the general assembly. Such amendment is also
	subject to the prior approval of the Ministry of Customs and Trade and the CMB. Furthermore, under the Turkish Commercial Code, during the general assembly meetings held to amend the articles&nbsp;of association of a joint stock company, each share
	shall be entitled to only one&nbsp;vote, even if otherwise is provided under its articles&nbsp;of association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	117
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage121"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any decrease in our share capital requires an amendment to our Articles&nbsp;of Association. If
	we undertake to cancel our&nbsp;shares, we must notify any existing creditors, and within two&nbsp;months of notification, they may request payment or, if their receivables are not due and payable, we must create a security interest in their favor.
	Capital reduction is rarely applied in Turkey.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	l.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Share Buy-Backs
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The new TCC contains several rules&nbsp;enabling Turkish companies to repurchase their own&nbsp;shares if they satisfy certain conditions.
	Accordingly,&nbsp;shares representing up to 10% of the total share capital of the company may be acquired by the company itself. Before the entry into force of the new TCC, the CMB had taken an anticipatory step by enabling listed companies to buy
	back their own&nbsp;shares. The CMB announced this on August&nbsp;11, 2011, in its Weekly Bulletin numbered 2011/32, and this announcement describes in detail the procedures and principles which apply to such buy-back transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accordance with the new Capital Markets Law dated December&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2012, the Communiqu&eacute; on Share Buyback numbered
	II-22.1&nbsp;was published in the Official Gazette on January&nbsp;3,&nbsp;2014. The Communiqu&eacute; regulates the principles and procedures of share buybacks or the establishment of pledges over their own&nbsp;shares by public companies.
	Essentially, the Communiqu&eacute; governs the principles regarding the (i)&nbsp;share buybacks of public companies or accepting their own&nbsp;shares as pledges; (ii)&nbsp;sell-out of repurchased&nbsp;shares or their amortization; (iii)&nbsp;public
	disclosure of such transactions; and (iv)&nbsp;safe harbor provisions where share buybacks will not be deemed insider trading or manipulation of the market.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Company currently is considering and evaluating the possibility to redeem its own shares. On February 18, 2016 a buyback plan of up to TRY
	200 million was announced to be submitted for the approval of the shareholders at the Ordinary General Assembly for 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	m.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	General
	Assemblies
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Right holders, who have a right to attend the general assembly meetings, can attend such meetings by electronic
	means pursuant to article&nbsp;1527&nbsp;of the new TCC. Pursuant to the Communiqu&eacute; on Electronic General Assembly Meetings held in Joint Stock Companies, the Company&nbsp;shall invite the right holders to attend, to deliver an opinion and to
	vote by electronic means, either setting up the electronic general assembly system; or purchase related services from the system providers that are specifically found for such purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the new TCC, the general assembly meeting procedures should be regulated under the Internal Guidelines to be approved by the
	general assembly and registered at the Trade Registry. Accordingly, general assembly meeting procedures shall be executed with the related provisions of the Turkish Commercial Code, Articles&nbsp;of Association and the Internal Guidelines.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following matters are among the ones required by the TCC and our Articles&nbsp;of Association to be included on the agenda of ordinary
	general assembly meeting:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	review of the annual reports of our Board of Directors and the auditors;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the approval, amendment or rejection of the statement of financial position and statement of profit and loss prepared for the preceding financial&nbsp;year, the release of our Board of Directors from liability in
	respect of actions taken by them in the preceding financial&nbsp;year, and the proposals of our Board of Directors for the allocation and distribution of any of our net profits;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the approval of the remuneration of the Board members; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the re-election or replacement of directors and/or auditors whose terms of office have expired.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Shareholders representing at least 5% of our share capital may, by written&nbsp;notice, require any additional matters to be included on the
	agenda for discussion at any of our general assemblies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notices covering general assemblies (including postponements and rescheduling),
	which include the agenda of any such general assembly, must be published in the Trade Registry Gazette and at least two leading Turkish newspapers published in Istanbul, determined by us, at least two&nbsp;weeks before the date fixed for the meeting
	in accordance with the TCC and three&nbsp;weeks before the date fixed for the meeting in accordance with CMB regulation. The TCC requires us to send notice of any general assembly by registered mail to each person registered in our books as a holder
	of&nbsp;shares and to those
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	118
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage122"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	shareholders who have deposited at least one&nbsp;share certificate representing&nbsp;shares with us and have indicated a notice address. Under the Capital Markets Law, such notice requirement
	does not apply to holders of registered&nbsp;shares, which are also traded in the stock market.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any shareholder holding any of
	our&nbsp;shares (excluding ADRs) and wishing to attend general assembly meetings to vote must present his/her identification document to our Head Office before the start of the meeting in order to obtain an entry permit for that meeting. Holders of
	the non-public registered&nbsp;shares in our share book of registered&nbsp;shares need not comply with such requirement to attend a general assembly. Any shareholder not wishing to attend any such general assembly in person may appoint another
	person as a proxy. Shareholders attending the general assembly meeting by electronic means should follow the procedures established by the related legislation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Except as set out by the provisions of the TCC and our Articles&nbsp;of Association, the required quorum at any general assembly is
	shareholders representing at least one-quarter of the share capital. If such quorum is not present when a general assembly is convened, the meeting shall be adjourned, in which event the meeting is reconvened within a&nbsp;month, with shareholders
	or their proxies present at such meeting. Resolutions of general assembly meetings must be passed by a majority of the shareholders or their proxies present at such meetings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As per the new Capital Markets Law, unless a higher quorum is accepted in the articles&nbsp;of association of public companies, affirmative
	votes of two-thirds of shareholders representing the share capital present at the general assembly (and this, without requiring a quorum) is needed for the following decisions: restricting preemptive rights of shareholders, authorizing the Board to
	restrict such preemptive rights in a registered capital system and reduction of the share capital and material transactions of the company as defined by the law. Nevertheless, if shareholders representing at least half of the company share capital
	are present at the meeting, simple majority decides unless a higher quorum is accepted by the articles&nbsp;of association.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition,
	the new Capital Markets Law stipulates that the CMB may require including some topics in the general assembly agenda to be discussed by the general assembly or to inform&nbsp;the shareholders at the general assembly.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to our Articles&nbsp;of Association, the meeting quorum requirement at general assemblies is 51% of our share capital. Resolutions
	of our general assemblies must be passed by the shareholders (or their proxies) representing the majority of the votes of the shareholders present at that meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The quorum requirement at general assemblies convened to increase our share capital ceiling is 51% of our share capital. Resolutions of
	general assemblies relating to capital increases must be passed by a majority of our shareholders or their proxies present at such meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The meeting quorum requirement at general assemblies convened to amend our Articles&nbsp;of Association (excluding capital ceiling
	increase)&nbsp;is two-thirds of our share capital. Resolutions of our general assemblies to amend our Articles&nbsp;of Association (excluding capital ceiling increase)&nbsp;shall be passed by the shareholders (or their proxies) representing at least
	2/3&nbsp;of the votes of the shareholders present at that meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Changing our jurisdiction or increasing the obligations of the
	shareholders requires unanimous shareholder approval.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_45">
</A>
	10.C Material Contracts
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We are not a party to any material contracts other than those entered into in the ordinary course of business, except with regard to the
	settlement of certain legal disputes. For information regarding these settlements, see &#147;Item&nbsp;8.A. Consolidated Statements and Other Financial Information&#151;Legal Proceedings&#148; and Note&nbsp;33&nbsp;(Guarantees and purchase
	obligations) to our Consolidated Financial Statements in this Form&nbsp;20-F.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_46">
</A>
	10.D Exchange Controls
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Banks in Turkey set their own foreign exchange rates independently of those announced by the Central Bank. Pursuant to Decree 32&nbsp;on the
	Protection of the Value of the Turkish Currency, most recently amended in 2003, the government eased and ultimately abolished restrictions on the convertibility of the Turkish Lira for current account and nonresident capital account transactions by
	facilitating exchange of the proceeds of transactions in Turkish securities by foreign investors, which enabled Turkish citizens to purchase securities on foreign exchanges. These changes also permitted residents and nonresidents to buy foreign
	exchange without limitation and to transfer such foreign exchange abroad without ministerial approval.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	119
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage123"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Turkish citizens are permitted to buy unlimited amounts of foreign currency from banks and to
	hold foreign exchange in commercial banks. Capital transfers outside Turkey of more than $5&nbsp;million still require approval of the Turkish government. Although we believe it is unlikely that exchange controls will be reintroduced in the near
	term, any such exchange controls may materially adversely affect our results of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December 31, 2015, exchange
	restrictions and state controls exist in some jurisdictions in which Turkcell operates. The local currencies of Turkcell&#146;s subsidiaries in both Ukraine and Belarus are not convertible outside of their respective countries. Future movements of
	exchange rates will affect the carrying values of Turkcell&#146;s assets and liabilities. The translation of underlying local currency amounts into USD in Turkcell&#146;s Consolidated Financial Statements should not be construed as a representation
	that such local currency amounts have been, could be or will in future be converted into USD at the exchange rates shown or at any other exchange rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December 31, 2015, significant exchange restrictions and state controls exist in most jurisdictions in which Fintur operates. The local
	currencies of Fintur subsidiaries in Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Georgia and Moldova are not convertible outside of their respective countries. Future movements of exchange rates will affect the carrying values of the Fintur&#146;s assets and
	liabilities. The translation of underlying local currency amounts into USD in Fintur&#146;s consolidated financial statements should not be construed as a representation that such local currency amounts have been, could be or will in future be
	converted into USD at the exchange rates shown or at any other exchange rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_TOC135598_47">
</A>
	10.E Taxation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following discussion is a summary of the material Turkish and United States federal income tax considerations relating to the ownership and
	disposition of our&nbsp;shares or ADSs. The discussion is based on current law and is for general information only. The discussion does not address all possible tax consequences relating to the ownership and disposition of&nbsp;shares, or ADSs, and
	holders are urged to consult their tax advisors regarding the applicable tax consequences of holding and disposing of the&nbsp;shares or ADSs based on their particular circumstances.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The discussion is based upon laws and relevant interpretations thereof in effect as of the date of this annual report, all of which are
	subject to change, possibly with retroactive effect. This summary is also based in part&nbsp;on representations of the Depositary and assumes that each obligation provided for in, or otherwise contemplated by, the Deposit Agreement or any related
	document will be performed in accordance with the terms of such agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	I. Republic of Turkey Taxation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following summary of Turkish tax law as in force on the date of this annual report describes the principal tax consequences for Turkish
	residents and U.S.&nbsp;holders (as defined below in &#147;Taxation&#151;United States Federal Income Taxation&#148;) of the ownership and disposition of&nbsp;shares and ADSs. It is not a complete description of all the possible tax consequences of
	such ownership and disposition. Shareholders should consult their own tax advisors concerning the Turkish and other tax consequences applicable in their particular situations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	a.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Corporate Taxation
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A corporation that has its legal and/or business center in Turkey (a &#147;Resident Corporation&#148;) is subject to a corporate tax, which is
	levied at 20% on such corporation&#146;s taxable income. Resident Corporations are required to pay an &#147;advance corporation tax&#148;, also at 20%, on a&nbsp;quarterly basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	b.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Taxation of Dividends
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event that a Resident Corporation distributes dividends to individual shareholders (resident or non-resident), or to non-resident
	corporations that do not have a permanent establishment (fixed place of business or permanent representative)&nbsp;in Turkey (and are not subject to rate-reducing provisions in applicable bilateral tax treaties), a 15% withholding tax is payable by
	the Resident Corporation on behalf of its shareholders. In the event that Resident Corporations distribute dividends to resident legal entities or to non-resident legal entities that have a permanent establishment in Turkey, such distributions are
	not subject to withholding tax.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	120
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage124"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cash dividends received by Resident Corporations from other Resident Corporations are not subject
	to corporate tax. Dividends in cash received by resident individuals from Resident Corporations are subject to a withholding tax at the rate of 15% (as discussed above)&nbsp;and must file an annual income tax declaration. The withholding tax amount
	shall be deducted from the annual income tax. 50% of the dividend income received by resident individuals from Resident Corporations is exempt from the annual income declaration. The remaining 50%&nbsp;must be declared if it exceeded TRY
	30,000&nbsp;in&nbsp;2016&nbsp;and TRY&nbsp;29,000&nbsp;in&nbsp;2015 (TRY&nbsp;27,000&nbsp;in&nbsp;2014).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the Income Tax Treaty
	between the United States of America and the Republic of Turkey, signed March&nbsp;28, 1996&nbsp;(the &#147;Treaty&#148;), the withholding tax rate is limited to 20% (including the surcharges on dividends paid by a Turkish Resident Corporation) of
	the gross amount of the dividends unless the beneficial owner of&nbsp;shares is a company which owns at least 10% of the voting stock of the company paying the dividends (in which case the rate would be limited to 15%). Because the current
	withholding tax rate applicable to publicly-traded corporations, such as Turkcell, is only 15%, the Treaty does not affect the current rate of Turkish withholding tax for U.S.&nbsp;holders. Cash dividends paid on ordinary&nbsp;shares or ADSs to a
	U.S.&nbsp;holder that does not have a permanent representative or place of business in Turkey will not be subject to taxation in Turkey, except in respect of the 15%&nbsp;income withholding tax discussed in the previous section. The distribution of
	dividends in kind (
<I>
	i.e.
</I>
	, bonus&nbsp;shares) is not subject to a withholding tax, and such dividends in kind are not subject to an income declaration.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	c.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Taxation of Capital Gains
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(i) Gains realized by Residents
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For&nbsp;shares acquired on or after January&nbsp;1, 2006:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Gains realized by resident individuals on the sale of&nbsp;shares traded on the Borsa Istanbul (such as Turkcell&nbsp;shares) or ADSs that
	represent&nbsp;shares traded on the Borsa Istanbul (such as Turkcell ADSs) to residents or non-residents are exempt from income tax, provided that the holding period of such&nbsp;shares or ADSs exceeds one&nbsp;year. Where this holding period has
	not been met, there is a withholding tax from the gains derived from capital. The current rate for such withholding tax is 0%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Gains
	realized by Resident Corporations on the sale of&nbsp;shares traded on the Borsa Istanbul (such as Turkcell&nbsp;shares) or ADSs that represent&nbsp;shares traded on the Borsa Istanbul (such as Turkcell ADSs) to residents or non-residents shall
	benefit from the withholding exemption, if a one-year holding period is met. However, where this holding period has not been met, there is a withholding tax from the gains derived from capital gains. The current rate for such withholding tax is 0%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Gains realized by Resident Corporations on the sale of&nbsp;shares or to residents or non-residents must be included in corporate income
	and are subject to the applicable corporate tax. Upon fulfillment of the stated conditions in Article&nbsp;5&nbsp;of the Corporate Tax Law, 75% of capital gains derived from the sale of the&nbsp;shares will be exempt from corporate income tax.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For&nbsp;shares acquired before January&nbsp;1, 2006:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Capital gains derived from&nbsp;shares held by an investor (both individuals and corporations) for over three&nbsp;months are not subject to
	any withholding tax. Where this holding period has not been met, capital gains received by individuals are computed by deducting the original cost of the&nbsp;shares or ADSs, after the application of a &#147;cost adjustment&#148; (which uses the
	Producer Price Index determined by the Turkish Statistical Institute to eliminate gain arising solely from inflation), from the amount received upon the sale or disposition of the&nbsp;shares or ADSs. Total capital gains are subject to declaration
	on the income tax return if they exceeded TRY 24,000 in 2016, TRY 23,000&nbsp;in&nbsp;2015&nbsp;and TRY&nbsp;21,000&nbsp;in&nbsp;2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Gains realized by Resident Corporations on the sale of&nbsp;shares are subject to the applicable corporate tax. Upon fulfillment of the stated
	conditions in Article&nbsp;5&nbsp;of the Corporate Tax Law, 75% of capital gains deriving from the sale of the&nbsp;shares will be exempt from corporate income tax.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(ii) Gains realized by U.S.&nbsp;holders
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	U.S.&nbsp;holders that do not have a permanent establishment in Turkey are exempt from Turkish tax on capital gains generated from the sale
	of&nbsp;shares quoted on an exchange, such as Turkcell&nbsp;shares, under Article&nbsp;13&nbsp;of the Treaty. U.S.&nbsp;resident legal entities having a permanent establishment (fixed place of business or permanent representative)&nbsp;in Turkey
	generally are subject to tax in Turkey on capital gains arising from the sale of such&nbsp;shares and should consult their own Turkish tax advisors as to the rules&nbsp;applicable to them. As of July&nbsp;7, 2006, the withholding tax rate applicable
	to non-resident holders of&nbsp;shares has been reduced to 0%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	121
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage125"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	U.S.&nbsp;holders who invest via ADSs will not have to comply with any procedures to avoid
	withholding tax, since gains derived from Turkcell ADSs are not generated in Turkey. However, U.S.&nbsp;holders who hold their&nbsp;shares directly in Turkey must comply with certain procedures to establish their exemption from Turkish capital gains
	withholding tax and are urged to consult their own tax advisors in this regard.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, certain rules&nbsp;and procedures may need
	to be complied with in order to avoid Turkish withholding tax upon the conversion of ADSs to&nbsp;shares and from&nbsp;shares to ADSs in Turkey. U.S.&nbsp;holders are urged to consult their own tax advisors in this regard.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Pursuant to a Turkish Constitutional Court decision, which annulled the income tax provision regulating the 0% withholding application on
	capital gains for non-resident individuals and corporations, the withholding tax regime has once again become subject to regulation&nbsp;pursuant to a law numbered 6009, which came into force on August&nbsp;1, 2010. Pursuant to this new regulation,
	a 10% withholding on capital gains is applied to individual investors and a 0% withholding is applied to corporate investors, irrespective of the residency status. Non-resident corporate deposit receipt holders (depositaries of our ADR facility) are
	included within the scope of corporate investors. Non-resident investors of Turkcell ADRs will be subject to 0% withholding, provided that the depositary of our ADR facility is a corporate body. The Turkish Council of Ministers has the authority to
	raise the withholding levels to 5&nbsp;percentage points.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	d.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Taxation of Investment and Mutual Funds
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(i) Taxation on the Fund Level:
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The gains realized from portfolio investment activities by resident Investment and Mutual Funds are exempt from corporate tax but are subject
	to withholding tax for the gains of stocks held and bonds/bills issued before January&nbsp;1, 2006. Withholding tax rates are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	if the institutions maintain a minimum of 25% of their portfolios invested in Turkish equity&nbsp;shares on a&nbsp;monthly weighted average basis, the applicable rate of withholding tax is 0%; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	if the&nbsp;percentage of Turkish equity&nbsp;shares in the portfolios of such institutions is below 25% during any&nbsp;month during the&nbsp;year, the applicable rate of withholding tax is 10%.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Gains from stocks purchased after January&nbsp;1, 2006&nbsp;and/or bonds and bills issued after January&nbsp;1, 2006&nbsp;are subject to
	withholding of 0%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A non-resident Investment or Mutual Fund may also qualify for this taxation regime if it appoints a permanent
	representative in Turkey, registers with the Turkish tax office, maintains legal books and meets the other tax requirements in Turkey.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	(ii)
	Taxation on the Investor Level:
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The gains realized by investors for participating within &#147;FUND&#148; are subject to taxation
	depending on the date of purchase of the &#147;FUND&#148; by the individual investors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For &#147;FUND&#148;&nbsp;shares purchased before January&nbsp;1, 2006, gains are not subject to income tax withholding. Capital gains received by individuals are computed by deducting the original cost of
	the&nbsp;shares after the application of a &#147;cost adjustment&#148; (which uses the Producer Price Index determined by the Turkish Statistical Institute to eliminate gains arising solely from inflation), from the amount received upon the sale or
	disposition of the&nbsp;shares. Total capital gains are subject to declaration on income tax returns if they exceeded TRY 24,000 in 2016, TRY 23,000&nbsp;in&nbsp;2015&nbsp;and TRY&nbsp;21,000&nbsp;in&nbsp;2014
	(TRY&nbsp;21,000&nbsp;in&nbsp;2013)&nbsp;and are required to be declared in compliance with the Turkish Tax Regime. For &#147;FUND&#148;&nbsp;shares purchased after January&nbsp;1, 2006:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the &#147;FUND&#148; maintains at least 51% of the portfolio invested in the Borsa Istanbul Market and is held for more than a one-year period, gains shall not be subjected to withholding. Such gains shall be
	declared in compliance with the Turkish Tax Regime.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the &#147;FUND&#148; does not meet the conditions above, gains shall be subject to withholding at 10% for resident investors. In cases where non-resident investors can certify their own residency status, 0%
	withholding shall be applied.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	122
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage126"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Pursuant to a Turkish Constitutional Court decision, which annulled the income tax provision regulating the 0% withholding application on capital gains for non-resident individuals and corporations, the withholding tax
	regime has once again become subject to regulation&nbsp;pursuant to a law numbered 6009, which came into force on August&nbsp;1, 2010. Pursuant to this new regulation, a 10% withholding on capital gains is applied to individual investors and a 0%
	withholding is applied to corporate investors, irrespective of the residency status. Non-resident corporate deposit receipt holders (depositaries of our ADR facility) are included within the scope of corporate investors. Non-resident investors of
	Turkcell ADRs will be subject to 0% withholding, provided that the depositary of our ADR facility is a corporate body.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	e.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Stamp Taxes
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the Turkish Stamp Tax Law (Law No.&nbsp;488), all agreements and documents specified in the law
	with a monetary value indicated thereon are subject to a stamp tax with rates from 0.189% to 0.948%, which is calculated on the aggregate amount of such agreement or document. Stamp tax to be calculated for a particular &#147;PAPER&#148; was capped
	at a maximum of TRY 1,487,397.70&nbsp;per original in&nbsp;2013&nbsp;and TRY&nbsp;1,545,852.40&nbsp;per original in&nbsp;2014, TRY 1,702,138.00 per original in 2015 and will be capped at a maximum of TRY&nbsp;1,797,117.30 per original in&nbsp;2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	f.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Certain Additional Tax Regulations
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Changes in the Ministry of Finance&#146;s interpretation of the taxation codes, especially changes regarding consumption taxes (Value Added Tax
	and Special Communication Tax), may adversely affect consumer prices. In addition to the prospective financial impact of such changes, unanticipated tax liabilities and fines may also be levied against our financial results in prior&nbsp;years since
	a Turkish company&#146;s operations in the previous five&nbsp;years may be subject to financial investigation. Regulations&nbsp;that became effective July&nbsp;1, 2010, however, have strengthened our rights with regards to this risk, particularly
	with regards to the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Tax inspectors shall not issue tax audit reports that contradict Decrees, Public Acts, Statutory Rules, General Communiqu&eacute;s and Circulars promulgated;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In the event that the tax authority differentiates previous interpretations of taxation codes via promulgated General Communiqu&eacute;s and Circulars, the new interpretation shall not be applied to previous
	transactions; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Transactions that are compliant with rulings taken from the Tax Office shall be relieved from both tax penalty and overdue interest. Such shelter is valid only for a taxpayer that has applied for the ruling.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	II. United States Federal Income Taxation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following discussion is a summary of the material U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax considerations applicable to the ownership and disposition
	of&nbsp;shares or ADSs by you, if you are a U.S.&nbsp;holder. In general you will be a &#147;U.S.&nbsp;holder&#148; if:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	you are the beneficial owner of our&nbsp;shares or ADSs;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	you are either (i)&nbsp;an individual resident or citizen of the United States, (ii)&nbsp;a corporation (or other entity taxable as a corporation for U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax purposes) created in or organized under
	the laws of the United States, any state thereof or the district of Columbia, (iii)&nbsp;an estate whose income is subject to U.S.&nbsp;federal income taxation regardless of its source, or (iv)&nbsp;a trust if a U.S. court can exercise primary
	supervision over the administration of the trust and one&nbsp;or more U.S.&nbsp;persons are authorized to control all substantial decisions of the trust;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	you own our&nbsp;shares or ADSs as capital assets (which generally means for investment purposes);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	you own directly, indirectly or by attribution less than 10% of our outstanding share capital or voting stock;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	you are fully eligible for benefits under the Limitation on Benefits article&nbsp;of the Treaty; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	you are not also a resident of Turkey for Turkish tax purposes.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Treaty benefits discussed
	generally are not available to holders who hold&nbsp;shares or ADSs in connection with the conduct of business through a permanent establishment, or the performance of personal services through a fixed base, in Turkey.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	123
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage127"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If a partnership (including for this purpose any entity or arrangement treated as a partnership
	for U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax purposes) holds&nbsp;shares or ADSs, the tax treatment of a partner generally will depend upon the status of the partner and the activities of the partnership. A partner in a partnership that holds&nbsp;shares or
	ADSs is urged to consult its own tax advisor regarding the specific tax consequences of owning and disposing of its&nbsp;shares or ADSs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The summary does not purport to be a comprehensive description of all of the tax considerations that may be relevant to any particular holder,
	including tax considerations that arise from rules&nbsp;of general application or that are generally assumed to be known by U.S. holders. This summary is based on provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &#147;Code&#148;),
	existing and proposed U.S. Treasury Regulations, rulings, administrative pronouncements, judicial decisions and the Treaty, all as of the date of this annual report. All of these authorities are subject to change, possibly with retroactive effect,
	and to differing interpretations. In addition, this summary does not discuss all aspects of U.S.&nbsp;federal income taxation that may be applicable to investors in light of their particular circumstances or to U.S.&nbsp;holders who are subject to
	special treatment under U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax law, including insurance companies, U.S. expatriates, dealers in stocks or securities, banks or financial institutions, tax-exempt organizations, regulated investment companies, retirement plans,
	traders in securities who elect to apply a mark-to-market method of accounting, persons who acquired their&nbsp;shares pursuant to the exercise of employee stock options or otherwise as compensation, persons holding&nbsp;shares as part&nbsp;of a
	straddle, hedging or conversion transaction, persons subject to the alternative minimum tax, and persons having a functional currency other than the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	U.S.&nbsp;holders are urged to consult with their own tax advisors regarding the tax consequences of the ownership or disposition
	of&nbsp;shares or ADSs, including the effects of federal, state, local, foreign and other tax laws with respect to their particular circumstances.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	a.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Dividends
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If we
	make distributions to you, you generally will be required to include in gross income as dividend income the amount of the distributions paid on the&nbsp;shares (including the amount of any Turkish taxes withheld in respect of such dividend as
	described above in &#147;Taxation&#151;Republic of Turkey Taxation&#148;). Dividends paid by us will not be eligible for the dividends-received deduction applicable in some cases to U.S.&nbsp;corporations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any dividend paid in Turkish Lira, including the amount of any Turkish taxes withheld therefrom, will be includible in your gross income in an
	amount equal to the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar value of the Turkish Lira calculated by reference to the spot rate of exchange in effect on the date the dividend is received by you, in the case of&nbsp;shares, or by the Depositary, in the case of ADSs,
	regardless of whether the Turkish Lira are converted into U.S.&nbsp;Dollars. Any gain or loss resulting from currency exchange fluctuations during the period from the date the dividend is includible in your gross income to the date such payment is
	converted into U.S.&nbsp;Dollars generally will be treated as U.S.&nbsp;source ordinary income or loss. Special rules&nbsp;govern, and elections are available to, accrual method taxpayers to determine the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar amount includible in income
	in the case of taxes withheld in a foreign currency. Accrual basis taxpayers are urged to consult their own tax advisors regarding the requirements and elections applicable in this regard.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any dividends paid by us to you with respect to&nbsp;shares or ADSs will be treated as foreign-source income and generally will be categorized
	as &#147;passive category income&#148; or, in the case of certain U.S.&nbsp;holders, &#147;general category income&#148; for foreign tax credit purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Subject to limitations, you may elect to claim a foreign tax credit against your U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax liability for Turkish income tax
	withheld from dividends received in respect of&nbsp;shares or ADSs. The rules&nbsp;relating to the determination of the foreign tax credit are complex. Accordingly, you should consult your own tax advisor to determine whether and to what extent you
	would be entitled to the credit. If you do not elect to claim a foreign tax credit, you may instead claim a deduction for Turkish income tax withheld, but only for a&nbsp;year in which you elect to do so with respect to all foreign income taxes. A
	deduction does not reduce tax on a dollar-for-dollar basis like a credit, but the deduction for foreign taxes is not subject to the same limitations applicable to foreign tax credits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Certain non-corporate U.S.&nbsp;holders (including individuals) are eligible for reduced rates of U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax in respect of
	&#147;qualified dividend income&#148; received. For this purpose, qualified dividend income generally includes dividends paid by a non-U.S.&nbsp;corporation if, amongst other things, the U.S.&nbsp;holder meets certain minimum holding periods and the
	non-U.S.&nbsp;corporation satisfies certain requirements, including that either (i)&nbsp;the&nbsp;shares (or ADSs) with respect to which the dividend income has been paid are readily tradable on an established securities market in the United
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	124
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage128"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	States or (ii)&nbsp;the non-U.S. corporation is eligible for the benefits of a comprehensive U.S.&nbsp;income tax treaty (such as the Treaty) which provides for the exchange of information. We
	currently believe that dividends paid with respect to our&nbsp;shares and ADSs should constitute qualified dividend income for U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax purposes, and we anticipate that our dividends will be reported as qualified dividends on
	Forms&nbsp;1099-DIV delivered to U.S.&nbsp;holders. In computing foreign tax credit limitations, non-corporate U.S.&nbsp;holders may take into account only a portion of a qualified dividend to reflect the reduced U.S.&nbsp;tax rate applicable to
	such dividend. Each U.S.&nbsp;holder of&nbsp;shares or ADSs is urged to consult its own tax advisor regarding the availability to it of the reduced dividend tax rate in light of its own particular situation and regarding the computations of its
	foreign tax credit limitation with respect to any qualified dividend income paid by us, as applicable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The U.S.&nbsp;Treasury has
	expressed concerns that parties to whom ADSs are released may be taking actions that are inconsistent with the claiming of foreign tax credits or reduced tax rates in respect of qualified dividends by U.S.&nbsp;holders of ADSs. Accordingly, the
	discussion above regarding the creditability of Turkish withholding tax on dividends or the availability of qualified dividend treatment could be affected by future actions that may be taken by the U.S.&nbsp;Treasury with respect to ADSs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	b.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Sale, Exchange or other Disposition of Shares or ADSs
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Upon the sale, exchange or other disposition of&nbsp;shares or ADSs, you generally will recognize capital gain or loss equal to the difference
	between the amount realized on the disposition and your adjusted tax basis in your&nbsp;shares or ADSs (as determined in U.S. Dollars). Gain or loss upon the disposition of&nbsp;shares or ADSs generally will be U.S.-source gain or loss, and will be
	treated as long-term capital gain or loss if, at the time of the disposition, your holding period for the&nbsp;shares or ADSs exceeds one&nbsp;year. If you are an individual, capital gains generally will be subject to U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax at
	preferential rates if specified minimum holding periods are met. The deductibility of capital losses is subject to significant limitations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The surrender of ADSs in exchange for&nbsp;shares pursuant to the Deposit Agreement governing the ADSs will not be a taxable event for
	U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax purposes. Accordingly, you will not recognize any gain or loss upon such surrender.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	c.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Net Investment Income
	Tax
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Certain U.S. holders that are individuals, estates or trusts and whose income exceeds certain thresholds generally
	will be subject to a 3.8% tax on &#147;net investment income&#148;, including, among other things, dividends on, and gains from the sale or other taxable disposition of, our&nbsp;shares and ADSs, subject to certain limitations and exceptions. You
	should consult your own tax advisor regarding the effect, if any, of such tax on your ownership and disposition of our&nbsp;shares and ADSs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	d.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Passive Foreign Investment Company
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Status
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We currently believe that we were not a passive foreign investment company (a &#147;PFIC&#148;) for U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax purposes for
	the taxable&nbsp;year ending December 31, 2015. However, this conclusion is a factual determination that must be made annually and thus may be subject to change. A non-U.S.&nbsp;corporation will be classified as a PFIC for any taxable&nbsp;year if
	at least 75% of its gross income consists of passive income (such as dividends, interest, rents, royalties or gains on the disposition of certain minority interests), or at least 50% of the average value of its assets consists of assets that
	produce, or are held for the production of, passive income. If we were characterized as a PFIC for any taxable&nbsp;year, you would suffer adverse tax consequences. These consequences may include having gains realized on the disposition
	of&nbsp;shares or ADSs treated as ordinary income rather than capital gains, and being subject to punitive interest charges on certain dividends and on the proceeds of the sale or other disposition of the&nbsp;shares or ADSs. Furthermore, dividends
	paid by a PFIC would not be &#147;qualified dividend income&#148; (as discussed above)&nbsp;and would be taxed at the higher rates applicable to other items of ordinary income. You should consult your own tax advisor regarding the potential
	application of the PFIC rules&nbsp;to us and to your ownership of our&nbsp;shares and ADSs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	e.
</B>
<B>
<I>
	U.S.
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Information Reporting and Backup Withholding
</I>
</B>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dividend payments with
	respect to&nbsp;shares or ADSs and proceeds from the sale, exchange, redemption or other disposition of&nbsp;shares or ADSs may be subject to information reporting to the Internal Revenue Service (the &#147;IRS&#148;) and possible U.S.&nbsp;backup
	withholding at a current rate of 28%. Certain exempt recipients (such as corporations) are not subject to these information reporting requirements. Backup withholding will not apply, however, to a holder who furnishes a correct taxpayer
	identification number or certificate of foreign status and makes any other required certification or who is otherwise
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	125
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage129"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	exempt from backup withholding. U.S. persons who are required to establish their exempt status generally must provide IRS Form&nbsp;W-9&nbsp;(Request for Taxpayer Identification Number&nbsp;and
	Certification). Non-U.S.&nbsp;holders generally will not be subject to U.S.&nbsp;information reporting or backup withholding. However, such holders may be required to provide certification of non-U.S.&nbsp;status (generally on IRS Form&nbsp;W-8BEN
	or W-8BEN-E, as applicable) in connection with payments received in the United States or through certain U.S.-related financial intermediaries.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Backup withholding is not an additional tax. Amounts withheld as backup withholding may be credited against a holder&#146;s U.S. federal
	income tax liability, and a holder may obtain a refund of any excess amounts withheld by filing the appropriate claim for refund with the IRS and furnishing any required information.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, U.S. holders should be aware of annual reporting requirements with respect to the holding of certain foreign financial assets,
	including our&nbsp;shares and ADSs that are not held in an account maintained by certain types of financial institutions, if the aggregate value of all of such assets exceeds $50,000&nbsp;(or $100,000&nbsp;for married couples filing a joint return).
	You should consult your own tax advisor regarding the application of the information reporting and backup withholding rules&nbsp;to our&nbsp;shares and ADSs and the application of the annual reporting requirements to your particular situation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

</P>

	maintained by the SEC in Room&nbsp;1580, 100&nbsp;F Street, N.E., Washington, D.C.&nbsp;20549. Copies of these materials are also available by mail from the Public Reference Section&nbsp;of the SEC, at 100&nbsp;F Street, N.E., Washington D.C. 20549,
	at prescribed rates.
