<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Belarusian Telecom
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The aggregate carrying amount of goodwill arising from the acquisition of Belarusian Telecom was totally impaired as at 31&nbsp;December 2011.
	The gross amount of goodwill accumulated impairment losses adjusted for the effects of hyperinflation and translation would have been amounting to TL 412,059 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: TL 514,964 and 31&nbsp;December 2013: TL
	507,867). The cumulative impairment loss recognized in the statement of profit and loss is TL 228,774.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Independent appraisals were
	obtained for fair values to determine recoverable amount for Best. For the purpose of impairment testing, assets that cannot be tested individually are grouped together into the smallest group of assets, cash generating units. As at 31&nbsp;December
	2015, impairment test for long-lived assets of Best is made on the assumption that Best is the cash generating unit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As the recoverable
	amounts based on the value in use of cash generating units was higher than the carrying amount of cash-generating units of Best, no impairment was recognized. The assumptions used in value in use calculation of Best were:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A 31.1% post-tax WACC rate for 2016 to 2020, a 30.5% post-tax WACC rate for after 2020 and a 11.0% terminal growth rate were used to
	extrapolate cash flows beyond the 5-year forecasts based on the business plans. The pre-tax rate for disclosure purposes was 32.6%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Impairment testing for cash-generating units containing goodwill
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Goodwill allocated to cash generating units and carrying values of all cash generating units are annually tested for impairment. The
	recoverable amounts (that is, higher of value in use and fair value less cost to sell) are normally determined on the basis of value in use, applying discounted cash flow calculation. Independent appraisals were obtained for fair values to determine
	recoverable amounts for Belarusian Telecom and Turkcell Superonline as at 31&nbsp;December 2015, the date of the goodwill impairment test.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In calculating the net present value of the future cash flows, certain assumptions are required to be made in respect of highly uncertain
	matters including management&#146;s expectations of growth in adjusted EBITDA, calculated as results from operating activities before depreciation and amortization and other income / (expenses), timing and quantum of future capital expenditure, long
	term growth rates, and the selection of discount rates to reflect the risks involved.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Turkcell Superonline
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at 31&nbsp;December 2015, the aggregate carrying amount of goodwill allocated to Turkcell Superonline is TL&nbsp;32,834 (31 December 2014:
	TL 32,384 and 31&nbsp;December 2013: TL 32,834).Independent appraisal was obtained for fair value to determine recoverable amounts. As the recoverable value based on the value in use of the cash generating units was estimated to be higher than
	carrying amount, no impairment was required for goodwill arising from the acquisition of Superonline as at 31&nbsp;December 2015. The calculation of the value in use was based on the following key assumptions:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Values assigned to adjusted EBITDA for the periods forecasted include the expected synergies to be achieved from operating as a part of the
	Group. Values assigned to this key assumption reflect past experience except for efficiency improvements and synergies. Management believes that any reasonably possible change in the key assumptions on which Superonline recoverable amount is based
	would not cause Superonline&#146;s carrying amount to exceed its recoverable amount.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-67
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The projection period for the purposes of goodwill impairment testing was taken as 5 years
	between 1&nbsp;January 2016 and 31&nbsp;December 2020.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cash flows for further periods (perpetuity) were extrapolated using a constant
	growth rate of 3.5%. This growth rate does not exceed the long-term average growth rate for the market in which Superonline operates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A
	16.5% post-tax WACC rate was applied in determining the recoverable amount of the cash-generating unit. Discounting post-tax cash flows at a post-tax discount rate and discounting pre-tax cash flows at pre-tax discount rate gave same results, since
	the pre-tax discount rate is the post-tax discount rate adjusted to reflect the specific amount and timing of the future tax cash flows. For disclosure purposes pre-tax discount rate is 20.2%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-68

<A NAME="eolPage213"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Impairment testing for intangible assets not yet available for use
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Turkcell
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at
	31&nbsp;December 2015, impairment test for long-lived assets of Turkcell was performed on the assumption that Turkcell Turkey Mobile is a cash generating unit. As the recoverable amounts based on the value in use of cash generating units was higher
	than the carrying amount of cash-generating units of Turkcell, no impairment was recognized. The assumptions used in value in use calculation of Turkcell were:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A 14.0% post-tax discount rate and a 5.0% terminal growth rate were used to extrapolate cash flows beyond the 5-year forecasts based on the
	business plans. The pre-tax rate for disclosure purposes was 16.2%.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Amortization expenses on intangible assets other than goodwill for the years ended
	31&nbsp;December 2015, 2014 and 2013 are TL 549,251, TL 481,737 and TL 456,274 respectively including impairment losses and recognized in direct cost of revenues. The impairment losses on intangible assets for the years ended 31&nbsp;December 2015,
	2014 and 2013 are nil, TL 12,063 and TL 31,087 respectively and recognized in depreciation expense. Computer software includes internally generated capitalized software development costs that meet the definition of an intangible asset. The amount of
	internally generated capitalized cost is TL 123,067 for the years ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: TL 110,391).
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_60"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:9PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="49%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_FIN135598_15">
</A>
	15.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Investment property
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group transferred various properties from owner occupied asset
	to investment property to earn rental income and/or for capital appreciation in 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Determination of the fair value of the
	Group&#146;s investment properties
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The fair value of the Group&#146;s investment properties as at 31&nbsp;December 2015 has been
	arrived at on the basis of a valuation carried out on the respective dates by independent valuation companies which are authorized by the Capital Markets Board, and have appropriate qualifications and recent experience in the valuation of properties
	in the relevant locations. The fair value of these investment properties was determined using a variety of valuation methods which are: income approach methods, (direct capitalization approach and income capitalization approach), cost approach and
	market approach. In estimating the fair value of the properties, the highest and best use of the property is its current use.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The rental
	income obtained during the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 is TL 1,836 (31 December 2014: TL 1,102). Total direct operating expense from investment property during the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 is TL 126 (31 December 2014: TL 119).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Details of the Group&#146;s investment properties and information about the fair value hierarchy as at 31&nbsp;December 2015 and 2014 are as
	follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	There were no transfers between Level 1 and Level 2 during the year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Significant unobservable
	inputs and sensitivity of the respective investment properties based on the valuation method are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fair value of the investment
	property which is measured based on the &#147;direct capitalization&#148; approach will increase / (decrease) significantly, when there is a significant decrease/ (increase) in capitalization rate and a significant increase/ (decrease) in current
	market rentals. Capitalization rate is calculated by dividing comparable properties&#146; annual net operating income by the selling price of the respective properties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the &#147;income capitalization&#148; approach, a significant increase/ (decrease) in rentals will cause a significant increase/
	(decrease)&nbsp;in the fair value. In addition, a slight decrease/ (increase) in risk premium and discount rate which are calculated by considering the current market conditions will cause a significant increase/ (decrease) in the fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-71
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage216"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the &#147;cost approach&#148;,&nbsp;a significant increase/ (decrease) of construction
	costs and miscellaneous costs of any similar properties in the market will cause a significant increase/ (decrease)&nbsp;in the fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the &#147;market approach&#148;,&nbsp;a significant increase/ (decrease) in the market value of any properties which are located in the
	similar areas with similar conditions will cause a significant increase (decrease)&nbsp;in the fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1.00PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-73
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Fintur
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s investment in Fintur Holdings BV (&#147;Fintur&#148;) amounts to TL 981,939 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014:
	TL 667,539).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2013, Fintur decided to distribute a dividend amounting to $105,000. The Company reduced the carrying value of investments
	in Fintur by the accrued dividend of $43,523 and this amount has been collected in July 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the General Assembly of
	Shareholders&#146; Meeting of Fintur, it has been decided on 23&nbsp;July 2014 to distribute a dividend amounting to $112,000. The Company reduced the carrying value of investments in Fintur by the accrued dividend of $46,424 and this amount has
	been collected in July 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In April 2008, the privatization of the Republic of Azerbaijan&#146;s 35.7% ownership in Azercell Telecom
	B.M. (&#147;Azercell&#148;), a 51% owned consolidated subsidiary of Fintur, was completed. The non-controlling shareholders in Azercell acquired the 35.7% shares of Republic of Azerbaijan increasing their effective ownership in Azercell to 49%. At
	the same time, the non-controlling shareholders in Azertel increased their ownership to 49%. Fintur&#146;s effective ownership in Azercell therefore remained at 51%. One of the non-controlling shareholders was also granted a put option, giving the
	shareholder the right to sell its 42.2% stake to Fintur at fair value in certain deadlock situations regarding significant decisions at the General Assembly. Fintur has initially accounted for the present value of the estimated option redemption
	amount as a provision and derecognized the non-controlling interest and the amounts recognized in equity regarding the measurement of put option amounting to TL (633,351)&nbsp;is accounted under equity, in accordance with the Group&#146;s accounting
	policy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On 17&nbsp;September 2015, TeliaSonera, which is one of Company&#146;s major shareholders and also the shareholder of Fintur with
	a 58.55% stake, announced its intent to exit from its Euroasian assets. The Company has appointed a strategic and financial advisor for the potential acquisition of the remaining 58.55% stake in Fintur. As of 26 February 2016, the Company has
	submitted a binding offer to acquire TeliaSonera&#146;s 58.55% stake in Fintur and its 24% direct stake in Kcell JSC (Kazakhstan).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-74
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
</B>
<I>
	Significant restrictions
</I>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at 31&nbsp;December 2015, significant exchange restrictions and state controls exist in most jurisdictions in which Fintur operates. The
	local currencies of Fintur subsidiaries in Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Georgia and Moldova are not convertible outside of the respective countries. Future movements of exchange rates will affect the carrying values of the Fintur&#146;s assets and
	liabilities. The translation of underlying local currency amounts into USD in Fintur&#146;s consolidated financial statements should not be construed as a representation that such local currency amounts have been, could be or will in future be
	converted into USD at the exchange rates shown or at any other exchange rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	A-Tel
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company accounted for its joint venture A-Tel by applying equity method accounting until 27&nbsp;August 2014. The Company&#146;s investment
	in A-Tel amounts to TL 46,624 as at 31&nbsp;December 2013. In accordance with Settlement Protocol signed with Bereket Holding A.&#350;. (formerly known as Bilgin Holding A.&#350;.) on 27&nbsp;August 2014, it has been decided to pay a compensation
	amounting to TL 30,428 to A-Tel and TL 19,161 has been recorded as other income after the elimination as a result of the decline in initial provision accrued amount from TL 68,750 to TL 30,428. Bereket Holding A.&#350;. and Savings Deposits
	Insurance Funds (&#147;SDIF&#148;) have waived from the lawsuit regarding alleged loss occurred from termination of Service Provider Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Additionally, Turkcell&#146;s whole stake in A-tel has been transferred to Bereket Holding A.&#350;. for a consideration of TL 31,025 within
	the context of the Share Sale Agreement signed on 27&nbsp;August 2014. Loss on sale amounting to TL 902 was recognized in the statement of profit or loss as detailed below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_66"></A>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	At 31&nbsp;December 2015, a deferred tax liability of TL 92,725 (31 December 2014: TL 64,436) for temporary differences of TL 463,623 (31
	December 2014: TL 322,179) related to investments in subsidiaries was not recognized because the Company controls whether the liability will be incurred and it is satisfied that it will not be incurred in the foreseeable future.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Unrecognized deferred tax assets
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Deferred tax assets have not been recognized in respect of the following items:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	The deductible temporary differences do not expire under current tax legislation. Turkish tax legislation does
	not allow companies to file tax returns on a consolidated basis. Therefore, deferred tax assets have not
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Trade receivables are shown net of allowance for doubtful debts amounting to TL 816,071 as at
	31&nbsp;December&nbsp;2015 (31 December 2014: TL 727,652). The change in allowance for trade receivables and due from related parties is disclosed in Note 35.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Letters of guarantee received with respect to the accounts and checks receivable are amounted to TL 134,798 and TL 162,204 as at
	31&nbsp;December 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The undue assigned contracted receivables are the remaining portion of the assigned
	receivables from the distributors related to the handset campaigns which will be collected from subscribers in instalments by the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-78
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage223"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Company. When monthly instalment is invoiced to the subscriber, related portion is transferred to &#147;receivables from subscribers&#148;. The Company measures the undue assigned contracted
	receivables at amortized cost, bears the credit risk and recognizes interest income throughout the contract period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The accrued income
	represents revenue accrued for subscriber calls (air-time) which have not been billed and will be billed within one year. Due to the volume of subscribers, there are different billing cycles; accordingly, an accrual is made at each period end to
	accrue revenue for rendered but not yet billed. Contracted receivables related to handset campaigns, which will be invoiced after one year is presented under non-current trade receivables amounting to TL 834,833 (31 December 2014: TL 779,925).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group&#146;s exposure to currency risks and impairment losses related to trade receivables are disclosed in Note 31.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The increase in VAT receivable mainly results from 4.5G license VAT payment made as at 26&nbsp;October 2015
	amounting to TL 933,447. Discount impact of VAT receivable amounting to TL 36,976 is recorded in finance costs (Note 11).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at
	31&nbsp;December 2015, restricted cash amounting to TL 349,243 represents the amounts deposited at a bank as guarantees in connection with the loans utilized by Astelit (Note 26) (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Prepaid expenses mainly comprises prepaid rent expenses and prepaid credit management fees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The amount to be received from the Ministry of Transport, Maritime Affairs and Communications is related with the construction and operation of
	mobile communication infrastructure in rural areas (&#147;Evrensel Project&#148;) as explained in Note 34. Receivables from Evrensel project have been presented on net basis with provision accrued amounting to TL 29,782.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

	F-79

	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES

	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015

	with the subscriber that require a minimum consideration.

	As at 31&nbsp;December 2015, the average maturity of time deposits is 27 days (31 December 2014: 67 days).

	The Group&#146;s exposure to interest rate risk and a sensitivity analysis for financial assets and liabilities are disclosed in Note 31.

	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_FIN135598_23">
</A>
	23.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Capital and reserves
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Share capital
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at 31&nbsp;December 2015, common stock represented 2,200,000,000 (31 December 2014: 2,200,000,000) authorized, issued and fully paid shares
	with a par value of TL 1 each. In accordance with the Law No.&nbsp;5083 with respect to TL, on 9&nbsp;May 2005, par value of each share is registered to be TL 1. In this respect, share capital presented in the consolidated financial statements
	refers to nominal amount of share capital registered by trade registry.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The holders of shares are entitled to receive dividends as
	declared and are entitled to one vote per share at meetings of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at 31&nbsp;December 2015, total number of pledged shares
	hold by various institutions is 995,509 (31&nbsp;December&nbsp;2014: 995,509).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Capital contribution
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Capital contribution comprises the contributed assets and certain liabilities that the government settled on behalf of the Group that do not
	meet the definition of a government grant which the government is acting in its capacity as a shareholder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-80
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage225"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Translation reserve
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The translation reserve comprises all foreign currency differences arising from the translation of the financial statements of foreign and
	domestic operations from their functional currencies to presentation currency of TL.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Fair value reserve
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The fair value reserve comprises the cumulative net change in the fair value of available-for-sale financial assets until the investments are
	derecognized or the asset is impaired.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Legal reserve
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the Turkish Commercial Code, Turkish companies are required to set aside first and second level legal reserves out of their profits.
	First level legal reserves are set aside 5% of the distributable income per statutory accounts each year. The ceiling on the first legal reserves is 20% of the paid-up capital. The reserve requirement ends when the 20% of paid-up capital level has
	been reached. Second legal reserves correspond to 10% of profits actually distributed after the deduction of the first legal reserves and the minimum obligatory dividend pay-out (5% of the paid-up capital). There is no ceiling for second legal
	reserves and they are accumulated every year. In this respect, legal reserve presented in the consolidated financial statements refers to nominal amount of legal reserve.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Cash flow hedging reserve
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The cash flow hedging reserve represents the cumulative effective portion of gains or losses arising on changes in fair value of hedging
	instruments entered into for cash flow hedges. The cumulative gain or loss arising on changes in fair value of the hedging instruments that are recognized and accumulated under the heading of cash flow hedging reserve will be reclassified to profit
	or loss only when the hedged transaction affects the profit or loss, or included as a basis adjustment to the non-financial hedged item, consistent with the relevant accounting policy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Reserve for non-controlling interest put option liability
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The reserve for non-controlling interest put option liability includes the difference between the put option liability granted to the
	non-controlling shareholders in existing subsidiaries recognized and the amount of non-controlling interest derecognized. Since the current option relates to the business combinations before 1&nbsp;January 2009, subsequent changes in the fair value
	of the put option liability other than unwind of discount and associated foreign exchange gains and losses are also recognized in this reserve.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Dividends
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Turkcell:
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On
	25&nbsp;March 2015, the Company&#146;s Board of Directors has proposed a dividend distribution for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 amounting to TL 3,925,000 (equivalent to $1,535,903 as at 26&nbsp;March 2015, date of
	Ordinary General Assembly Meeting), which represented 42.5% of distributable income. This represents a net cash dividend of full TL 1.784091 (equivalent to full $0.70 as at 26&nbsp;March 2015, date of Ordinary General Assembly Meeting) per share.
	This dividend proposal was
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-81
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<I>
	Azerinteltek:
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the Ordinary General Assembly of Shareholders&#146; Meeting of Azerinteltek held on 25&nbsp;February 2014, it had been decided to distribute
	dividends amounting to AZN 227 (equivalent to TL 424 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015). The dividend was paid in two installments on 19&nbsp;March 2014 and 27&nbsp;March 2014 to the shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the Ordinary General Assembly of Shareholders Meeting of&nbsp;Azerinteltek held on 25&nbsp;February 2014, it has been decided to pay
	dividends to the Shareholders in proportion of their shares on interim basis in advance during 2014 financial year after fulfillment of liabilities arising from the Shareholder Agreement and payment of the current debts. According to the resolution
	of the General Assembly Meeting of the Company, on 17&nbsp;April 2014 Azerinteltek&#146;s Board of Directors has decided to distribute the dividend accrued in the first quarter of 2014 financial year amounting to AZN 3,631 (equivalent to TL 6,777 as
	at 31&nbsp;December 2015). Dividend payments have been completed as at 4&nbsp;August 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the resolution of the General
	Assembly Meeting of&nbsp;Azerinteltek, Azerinteltek&#146;s Board of Directors has decided to pay the dividend accrued in the second and third quarters of 2014 financial year amounting to AZN 2,146 (equivalent to TL 4,005 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015)
	on 23&nbsp;October 2014. Dividend payments have been completed as at 4&nbsp;November 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the resolution of the General
	Assembly Meeting of&nbsp;Azerinteltek, Azerinteltek&#146;s Board of Directors has decided on 22&nbsp;January 2015 to pay the dividend accrued in the fourth quarter of 2014 financial year amounting to AZN 2,258 (equivalent to TL 4,214 as at
	31&nbsp;December 2015). Dividend payments have been completed as at 28&nbsp;January 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the resolution of the General
	Assembly Meeting of&nbsp;Azerinteltek, Azerinteltek&#146;s Board of Directors has decided on 30&nbsp;April 2015 to pay the dividend accrued in the first quarters of 2015 financial year amounting to AZN 2,151 (equivalent to TL 4,015 as at
	31&nbsp;December 2015) and the remaining amount of AZN 134 (equivalent to TL 250 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) from 2014 financial year. Dividend payments have been completed as at 4&nbsp;May 2015 and 5&nbsp;May 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the resolution of the General Assembly Meeting of&nbsp;Azerinteltek, Azerinteltek&#146;s Board of Directors has decided on
	9&nbsp;July 2015 to pay the dividend accrued in the second quarter of 2015 financial year amounting to AZN 530 (equivalent to TL 989 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015). The dividend was paid in two installments on 10&nbsp;July 2015 and 7&nbsp;August 2015
	to the shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to the resolution of the General Assembly Meeting of&nbsp;Azerinteltek, Azerinteltek&#146;s Board of
	Directors has decided on 12&nbsp;October 2015 to pay the dividend accrued in the third quarter of 2015 financial year amounting to AZN 822 (equivalent to TL 1,534 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015). The dividend was paid in two installments on
	16&nbsp;October 2015 and 3&nbsp;December 2015 to the shareholders.
</P>

<I>
	Inteltek:
</I>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Furthermore, according to the resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly Meeting of&nbsp;Inteltek Internet Teknoloji Yatirim ve Danismanlik
	Ticaret A.S. (&#147;Inteltek&#148;), Inteltek&#146;s Board of Directors has decided on 25&nbsp;June 2015 to pay the dividend accrued in 2012, 2013 and 2014 financial years amounting to TL 173,456. The dividend was paid in two installments on
	29&nbsp;July 2015 and 19&nbsp;August 2015 to the shareholders.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Furthermore, according to the resolution of the Extraordinary General
	Assembly Meeting of&nbsp;Inteltek held on 11&nbsp;November 2015, Inteltek&#146;s Board of Directors has decided on 13&nbsp;November 2015 to pay the dividend accrued in the first nine months of 2015 financial year amounting to TL 32,192. Dividend
	payments have been completed as at 30&nbsp;November 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	24.
</B>
</TD>

	Earnings per share
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The calculations of basic and diluted earnings per share as at
	31&nbsp;December 2015 were based on the profit attributable to ordinary shareholders for the years ended 31&nbsp;December 2015, 2014 and 2013 of TL 2,067,654, TL 1,864,640 and TL 2,325,914 respectively and a weighted average number of shares
	outstanding during the years ended 31&nbsp;December 2015, 2014 and 2013 of 2,200,000,000 calculated as follows:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Consideration payable in relation to the acquisition of Belarusian Telecom represents the present value of the
	long-term contingent payment to the seller. Payment of $100,000 (equivalent to TL 290,760 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) is contingent on the financial performance of Belarusian Telecom, and based on management&#146;s estimations, expected to be paid
	during the first quarter of 2020 (31 December 2014: the first quarter of 2022).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-83
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_FIN135598_26">
</A>
	26.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Loans and borrowings
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This note provides information about the contractual terms of the
	Group&#146;s interest-bearing loans and borrowings, which are measured at amortized cost. For more information about the Group&#146;s exposure to foreign currency for interest bearing loans, see Note 31.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Terms and conditions of outstanding loans are as follows:
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Following the acquisition of 44.96% interest in Euroasia from SCM Holdings Limited&#146;s
	(&#147;SCM&#148;), Astelit&#146;s borrowings obtained from and with guarantee of SCM Group have been repaid in July 2015. The Group converted a material portion of Astelit&#146;s borrowings to equity and restructured Astelit&#146;s remaining
	borrowings in order to mitigate the foreign exchange risks associated with borrowings denominated in foreign currency. Astelit&#146;s capital has been increased by $686,000 (equivalent to TL 1,994,614 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) and Astelit
	obtained $66,000 (equivalent to TL 191,902 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) subordinated loan directly from the Company in the third quarter of 2015. Additionally, under the guarantee of Turkcell, Astelit utilized loans fully denominated in local
	currency which is UAH 3.55&nbsp;million (equivalent to TL 430,071 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015). Regarding UAH 2.5&nbsp;million (equivalent to TL 302,867 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) of these loans, a cash collateral of $120,114 (equivalent to TL
	349,243 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) has been provided by Turkcell and recognised in other currents assets in the financial statements as at 31&nbsp;December 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In line with the Group&#146;s strategic priority of improving balance sheet structure, the Company has restructured the outstanding debt of
	Belarusian Telecom. As part of the restructuring, Belarusian Telecom&#146;s total existing intragroup loans were converted into a EUR 610,213 (equivalent to TL 1,939,013 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) subordinated loan, provided directly by Turkcell.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company signed a loan agreement with BNP Paribas, Citibank, HSBC, ING and Intesa Sanpaolo SpA for an amount of $500,000 (equivalent to
	TL 1,453,800 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) and EUR 445,315 (equivalent to TL 1,415,033 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) with an availability period until 30&nbsp;June 2016 to be utilized by the Company and its subsidiaries for the purpose of funding
	infrastructure investments and any other potential investment opportunities. Each respective unsecured loan has 2 years grace period, 5 years maturity, principal repayment every 6 months and an annual interest rate of 3 month LIBOR/EURIBOR+ 2%. As
	at 31&nbsp;December 2015, the Company has not utilized any amount under this agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Additionally, as at 23&nbsp;October 2015 the
	Company signed a loan agreement package with China Development Bank (CDB) for an amount of up to EUR 500,000 (equivalent to TL 1,588,800 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) with 2 years availability period to refinance the Group&#146;s existing loans and
	for an amount of up to EUR 750,000 (equivalent to TL 2,383,200 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) with 3 years availability period to finance the Group&#146;s procurements from China in relation to infrastructure investments. The total loan package has 10
	years final maturity with 3 years grace period and will be paid back in equal installments. The annual interest rate of the loan is EURIBOR + 2.2%. As at 26&nbsp;October 2015, the Company utilized EUR 500,000 (equivalent to TL 1,588,800 as at
	31&nbsp;December 2015) under this agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has completed the sale process of its debt securities issuance on 15&nbsp;October
	2015; for an aggregate principal amount of USD 500,000 (equivalent to TL 1,453,800 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) with 10 years maturity, a redemption date of 15&nbsp;October 2025 and a coupon rate of 5.75% being paid semi-annually, priced on a 5.95%
	reoffer yield to qualified investors domiciled outside of Turkey. The notes are listed on the official list of the Irish Stock Exchange and the proceeds have been transferred to the Company&#146;s accounts on 15&nbsp;October 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-86
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage231"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Finance lease liabilities are payable as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_80"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="92%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Interest collars:
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under interest rate collar contracts, the Group agrees to exchange the difference between the collar (1.25%&nbsp;&#150;4%) and floating rate
	(LIBOR) interest amounts calculated on agreed notional principal amounts. Such contracts enable the Group to mitigate the risk of changing interest rates on the cash flow exposures on the issued variable rate debt. The fair value of interest rate
	collar at the end of the reporting period is determined by the quotations by the financial institutions and is disclosed below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	following tables detail the notional principal amounts outstanding at the end of the reporting period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="92%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All interest rate collar contracts exchanging floating rate interest amounts for fixed rate interest amounts
	are designated as cash flow hedges in order to reduce the Group&#146;s cash flow exposure resulting from variable interest rates on borrowings. The interest rate collars and the interest payments on the loan occur simultaneously and the amount
	accumulated in equity is reclassified to profit or loss over the period that the floating rate interest payments on debt affect profit or loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-87
</P>

<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_FIN135598_27">
</A>
	27.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Employee benefits
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	International Accounting Standard No 19 &#147;
<I>
	Employee
	Benefits
</I>
	&#148; (&#147;IAS 19&#148;) requires actuarial valuation methods to be developed to estimate the enterprise&#146;s obligation under defined benefit plans. As detailed in Note 10, such actuarial gains/losses are recognized within other
	comprehensive income starting from 31&nbsp;December 2012. The liability for this retirement pay obligation is recorded in the accompanying consolidated financial statements at its present value using a discount rate between 4.55% and 4.80% depending
	on the expected payout date (31 December 2014: between 3.46% and 3.82%).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Movement in the reserve for employee termination benefits as at
	31&nbsp;December 2015 and 2014 are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Actuarial loss amounting to TL 13,466 has been reflected in other comprehensive income for the year ended
	31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: TL 819 actuarial loss).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The liability is not funded, as there is no funding requirement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Obligations for contributions to defined contribution plans are recognized as an expense in the consolidated statement of profit or loss as
	incurred. The Group incurred TL 8,364, TL 7,876 and TL 6,576 in relation to defined contribution retirement plan for the years ended 31&nbsp;December 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</P>

	prepaid subscribers and it is classified as current as at 31&nbsp;December 2015 and 2014. The amount of deferred income is TL 121,078 and TL 164,423 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015 and 2014, respectively.

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(*)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Regarding the settlement made with Turk Telekom Group (Note 34), the Company has reversed legal provision amounting to TL 156,864 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Legal provisions are set for the probable cash outflows related to legal disputes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group is required to incur certain costs in respect of a liability to dismantle and remove assets and to restore sites on which the assets
	were located. The dismantling costs are calculated according to best estimate of future expected payments discounted at a pre-tax discount rate that reflects current market assessments of the time value of money and the risks specific to the
	liability.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The above mentioned additions to obligations for dismantling, removing and site restoration during the period are non-cash
	transactions recorded against property, plant and equipment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
<I>
	Current provisions:
</I>
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Legal provisions are set for the probable cash outflows related to legal disputes. In Note 34, under legal
	proceedings section, detailed explanations are given with respect to legal provisions.
</P>

<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>

	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The bonus provision totaling to TL 141,855 comprises mainly the provision for the year ended
	31&nbsp;December&nbsp;2015 and is planned to be paid in March 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.5G license payables are related to the frequency bands which the Company has been awarded with, from
	Authorization Tender on IMT Services and Infrastructure tender. Non-current trade and other payables consist of 4.5G license payable amounting to TL 1,270,610 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015 (Note 1 and 14).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Balances payables to suppliers are arising in the ordinary course of business.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Taxes and withholdings include VAT payable, special communications tax, frequency usage fees payable to ICTA and personnel income taxes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Turkcell and Turk Telekom Group agreed to settle ongoing lawsuits and disputes as at 31&nbsp;December 2015. In this regard, Turkcell agreed to
	make a payment of TL 309,250 (including VAT and special communication tax) to Turk Telekom Group. The payment was made on 14&nbsp;January 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accordance with the license agreement, Turkcell pays 90% of the treasury share, which equals 15% of its gross revenue, to the Turkish
	Treasury and 10% of the treasury share as universal service fund to the Turkish Ministry.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Selling and marketing expense accrual is mainly
	resulted from services received from third parties related to marketing activities of the Group which are not yet invoiced.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-90
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage235"></A>

	&nbsp;

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	**

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Non-financial instruments such as prepaid expenses and advances given are excluded from other current assets and other non-current assets.
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The impairment loss recognized of TL 196,588 for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 relates to its estimate
	of incurred losses in respect of trade receivables and due from related parties (31&nbsp;December&nbsp;2014: TL&nbsp;155,931).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Trade
	receivables and due from related parties are reserved in an allowance account until the Group can determine that the amounts are no longer collectible. When this becomes probable the Group reverses the allowance and writes-off the receivable.
</P>

<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following tables detail the Group&#146;s remaining contractual maturity for its financial
	liabilities with agreed repayment periods. The tables have been drawn up based on the undiscounted cash flows of financial liabilities based on the earliest date on which the Group can be required to pay. The tables include both interest and
	principal cash flows. To the extent that interest flows are floating rate, the undiscounted amount is derived from interest rate curves at the end of the reporting period. The contractual maturity is based on the earliest date on which the Group may
	be required to pay.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Sensitivity analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The basis for the sensitivity analysis to measure foreign exchange risk is an aggregate corporate-level currency exposure. The aggregate
	foreign exchange exposure is composed of all assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies. The analysis excludes net foreign currency investments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10% strengthening of the TL, UAH, BYR against the following currencies as at 31&nbsp;December 2015 and 2014 would have increased / (decreased)
	profit or loss before by the amounts shown below. This analysis assumes that all other variables, in particular interest rates, remain constant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)

	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Interest rate risk
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at 31&nbsp;December 2015 and 2014 the interest rate profile of the Group&#146;s interest-bearing financial instruments was:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Sensitivity analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Cash flow sensitivity analysis for variable rate instruments:
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A change of 100 basis points in interest rates as at 31&nbsp;December 2015 would have increased / (decreased) equity and profit or loss by the
	amounts shown below. This analysis assumes that all other variables, in particular foreign exchange rates, remain constant. The analysis is performed on the same basis as at 31&nbsp;December&nbsp;2015 and 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Fair values
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
<I>
	Fair value of the Group&#146;s financial assets and financial liabilities that are measured at fair value on a recurring
	basis
</I>
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Some of the Group&#146;s financial assets and financial liabilities are measured at fair value at the end of each
	reporting period. The following table gives information about how the fair values of these financial assets and financial liabilities are determined (in particular, the valuation technique(s) and inputs used).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31&nbsp;December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Relationship of unobservable inputs to fair value is the higher the discount rate, the lower
	the fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
<I>
	Fair value of financial assets and financial liabilities that are not measured at fair value on a
	recurring basis (but fair value disclosures are required).
</I>
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Except as detailed in the following table, the directors
	consider that the carrying amounts of financial assets and financial liabilities recognized in the consolidated financial statements approximate their fair values.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The categories of financial assets and financial liabilities that are not measured at fair value on a recurring basis (but fair value
	disclosures are required) are stated below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	The lease contracts, which mainly comprise leases of radio,
	transmission, office and internet capacity, expire on various dates. The Group does not have right to purchase the leased asset at the end of the lease period. Price escalation clauses of renewal conditions in operational lease agreements differ
	according to various conditions.
</P>

<A NAME="D135598D20F_HTM_FIN135598_33">

	33.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Guarantees and purchase obligations
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at 31&nbsp;December 2015, outstanding purchase
	commitments with respect to the acquisition of property, plant and equipment, inventory and purchase of sponsorship, rent and advertisement services amount to TL&nbsp;2,752,139 (31&nbsp;December&nbsp;2014: TL 3,793,226). Payments for these
	commitments are going to be made in a 5 year period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at 31&nbsp;December 2015, the Group is contingently liable in respect of bank
	letters of guarantee obtained from banks given to customs authorities, private companies and other public organizations, provided guarantees to private companies and financial guarantees to subsidiaries totaling to TL 2,058,810 as at
	31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: TL 3,789,979).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-100
</P>
