<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Dispute regarding the fine applied by ICTA regarding breaching confidentiality of personal
	data and relevant legislation which is launched by ICTA
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Upon the investigation ICTA decided to launch, related to breaching
	confidentiality of personal data and relevant legislation, within the context of the news in the press regarding unlawful wiretapping, ICTA decided to impose an administrative fine on the Company amounting to TL 11,225 and its decision was delivered
	to the Company on 6&nbsp;June 2011. Since the administrative fine was paid within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and TL 8,418 was paid on 5&nbsp;July 2011. On 24&nbsp;August 2011, the Company
	filed a lawsuit for the annulment of the decision with stay of execution request. The Court rejected the case. The Company appealed the decision. Council of State rejected the Company&#146;s stay of execution request at appeal phase. The Company
	requested stay of execution for the second time. The Council of State, decided to approve the First Instance Court&#146;s decision. The Company applied for the correction of the decision.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Dispute with Avea on SMS interconnection termination fees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On 22&nbsp;December 2006, Avea initiated a lawsuit against the Company claiming that although there was an agreement between the Company and
	Avea stating that both parties would not charge any SMS interconnection termination fees, the Company has charged SMS interconnection fees for the messages terminating on its own network and also assumed liabilities for the SMS terminating on
	Avea&#146;s network and made interconnection payments to Avea after deducting the net balance of those SMS charges and accruals. Avea requested provisions of Interconnection Agreement regarding SMS pricing to be applied and requested collection of
	its losses amounting to nominal amount of TL 6,480 for the period between January 2006 and August 2006 with its accrued interest till payment. On 25&nbsp;November 2008, the Court decided in favor of Avea. The Company has appealed the decision.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Supreme Court of Appeal reversed the judgment of the Local Court. The Company has applied for the correction in terms of justification of the
	decision for the Supreme Court&#146;s reversal decision. Avea has also applied for the correction of the decision. Supreme Court rejected the request for correction of the decision of Avea, and partially accepted the Company&#146;s demand. On
	13&nbsp;December 2011, the Local Court decided to accept the lawsuit again. The Company appealed the decision. The Court of Cassation decided to approve the decision of the First Instance Court. The Company applied for the correction of the
	decision. The Court of Cassation rejected the correction of the decision requests. The Company applied to the Constitutional Court against the decision.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has paid the principal of TL 6,480 late payment interest of TL 5,103 and related fees of TL&nbsp;524 on 30&nbsp;March 2009.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In line with the court decision stating that charging SMS interconnection termination fees violates the agreement between the Company and Avea,
	neither SMS interconnection revenue nor SMS interconnection expense has been recognized from February 2005 to 23&nbsp;March 2007.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Moreover, the Company applied to ICTA for the determination SMS interconnection termination fees and starting from 23&nbsp;March 2007, the
	Company has applied the SMS interconnection termination fees announced by ICTA until January 2009. ICTA determined new SMS termination rate in January 2009 upon the application of Avea.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since it is not virtually certain that an inflow of economic benefits will arise, no asset or related income is recognized in the consolidated
	financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31&nbsp;December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-128
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage273"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA upon complaint of subscriber of data tariffs&#146;
	charging
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In consequence of consumer complaint, ICTA notified the Company on 3&nbsp;October 2011, to impose an administrative fine
	amounting to TL 1,645. Since the administrative fine was paid within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and payment totaling to TL 1,234 was made on 1&nbsp;November 2011. The Company filed a lawsuit
	on 2&nbsp;December 2011 for the stay of execution and cancellation of the administrative fine. The stay of execution request has been rejected. The Company objected to the decision. The Regional Ankara Administrative Court rejected the objection.
	The Court rejected the case. The Company appealed the decision. Council of State rejected the Company&#146;s stay of execution requests at appeal phase. Appeal process is still pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation of ICTA on the implementation of article 18 of &#147;By-law on Consumer Rights in the Electronic Communications Sector&#148;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On 22&nbsp;February 2011, ICTA decided to investigate compatibility of Company&#146;s practices regarding the &#147;cancellation
	procedure&#148; which is regulated at article 18 of the
<I>
	By-law on Consumer Rights in the Electronic Communications Sector
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA,
	with its decision which was notified to the Company on 19&nbsp;August 2011, decided to impose an administrative fine amounting to TL 11,442. Since the administrative fine paid within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, 25%
	discount applied and TL 8,581 is paid in total on 15&nbsp;September 2011. On 18&nbsp;October 2011, the Company filed a lawsuit for the annulment of the decision with stay of execution request. The Court rejected the request of the Company for stay
	of execution. The Company objected to the decision. The objection was dismissed. The court rejected the lawsuit. The Company appealed the decision. The Council of State rejected the Company&#146;s request for stay of execution during the appeal
	process. Appeal process is still pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On the other hand, ICTA, with its decision which was notified to the Company on 1&nbsp;February
	2013, imposed another administrative fine amounting to TL 1,000 about the Company&#146;s practices regarding the &#147;subscription cancellation procedure&#148;. Since the administrative fine paid within 1 month following the notification of the
	decision of ICTA, 25% discount applied and TL 750 is paid in total on 15&nbsp;March 2013. On 1&nbsp;April 2013, the Company filed a lawsuit for the annulment of the decision with stay of execution request. The Court decided to analyze the
	Company&#146;s stay of execution request after ICTA submits its plea of defense. The Court rejected the Company&#146;s request for stay of execution. The Company objected to this decision. The objection was rejected. The Court rejected the lawsuit.
	The Company appealed the decision. The Council of State approved the decision of the First Instance Court. The Company applied for the correction of the decision in due time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation of ICTA regarding access failures on emergency call services
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On 16&nbsp;June 2011, ICTA decided to initiate an investigation in order to evaluate the Company&#146;s access failures realized on emergency
	call services which are deemed as critically important for end-users. Investigation Report is submitted to the Company on 28&nbsp;December 2011 and the Company submitted its defense statement to ICTA within the due date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On 26&nbsp;June 2012, ICTA decided to impose administrative fine to the Company amounting to TL 1,809 with the reasons that the Company has not
	given priority to the failures and has not given the requested information for the investigation in due time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-129
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage274"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine was paid within 1 month beginning from the notification of the
	decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and TL 1,357 was paid on 3&nbsp;October 2012. The Company filed two lawsuits on 5&nbsp;November 2012 for the stay of execution and cancellation of the decision. The Court rejected the Company&#146;s stay of
	execution demand on the case filed for the cancellation of the administrative fine which was imposed to the Company with the reason that the Company has not given priority to fix the failures. The Company objected to the decision, but objection was
	rejected. The Court rejected this case. The Company appealed the decision. The Council of State approved the decision of the First Instance Court. The Company applied to the correction of the decision. The Council of State rejected the correction of
	the decision requests. The Company made an individual application against the decision, before the Constitutional Court.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Court
	rejected the Company&#146;s stay of execution request on the other lawsuit, which was filed for the cancellation of the administrative fine, imposed to the Company for not giving the requested information in due time. The Company objected to the
	decision. The objection was rejected. The Court rejected this case. The Company appealed the decision. The Council of State approved the decision of the First Instance Court. The Company applied to the correction of the decision. The correction of
	the decision process is pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation of ICTA regarding &#147;Atlas of Places Only Turkcell Covers&#148; distributed with
	Tempo magazine
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On 2&nbsp;November 2011, ICTA decided to initiate an investigation regarding &#147;Atlas of Places Only Turkcell
	Covers&#148; which locations marked on the map of Turkey with &#147;only&#148; Turkcell coverage. As a result of the investigation, ICTA imposed an administrative fine amounting to TL 1,635 and the decision was notified to the Company on
	6&nbsp;August 2012. Since the administrative fine paid within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, 25% discount applied and TL 1,226 was paid on 4&nbsp;September 2012. The Company filed a lawsuit on 2&nbsp;October 2012 for
	stay of execution and for the annulment of the decision. The court rejected the stay of execution request. The Company objected the decision. The objection was rejected. The Court rejected the lawsuit. The Company appealed the decision. The Council
	of State approved the decision of the First Instance Court. The Company applied for the correction of the decision. The Council of State rejected the Company&#146;s correction of the decision request. The Company applied to the Constitutional Court
	against the decision. Examination is in progress.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Dispute with ICTA regarding annual radio utilization fees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company filed a lawsuit before ICC in April 2012, claiming that the Company is not obliged to pay treasury share and ICTA Fee in accordance
	with the 8th and 9th Articles of the Concession Agreement, respectively, on annual utilization fees deducted from the prepaid subscribers and return of overpaid TL&nbsp;5,852 treasury share for the period between August 2011 and February 2012. The
	Tribunal has partially accepted the case in favor of the Company and awarded that the Company is entitled to receive overpaid treasury share amounting TL 4,100 together with simple legal interest. Two lawsuits one by ICTA, and one by
	Undersecretariat of Treasury and the Ministry of Transport, Maritime Affairs, and Communications were filed for cancellation of the Final Award. The cases were dismissed by the Courts. Both ICTA and Undersecretariat of Treasury and the Ministry of
	Transport appealed the decision. The Supreme Court of Appeal reversed the decision of the First Instance Court. The Company applied for the correction of the decision. Undersecretariat of Treasury and Ministry of Transport submitted its reply to the
	correction of decision The correction of the decision process is pending. Appeal process is still pending for the lawsuit which is initiated by ICTA.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-130
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage275"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since it is not virtually certain that an inflow of economic benefits will arise, no asset or
	related income is recognized in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31&nbsp;December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Administrative fine imposed by the ICTA regarding base stations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Istanbul Regional Directorate of ICTA, has decided to impose an administrative fine to the Company in the amount of TL 2,057, on the ground
	that the measurement reports of 484 base stations was not submitted to the ICTA by the Company in the 30-day period pursuant to the regulations, after commissioning of systems are activated. The Company filed a lawsuit on 25&nbsp;April 2008 for stay
	of execution and for the annulment of the decision. The court rejected the lawsuit. The Company appealed the decision. The Council of State reversed the first instance court&#146;s decision on the ground that Istanbul Regional Directorate of ICTA
	has not been authorized to impose aforementioned administrative fine. The Court of First Instance decided to accept the lawsuit in accordance with the reversal decision of the Council of State. ICTA appealed the decision. The Company replied the
	appeal request. Appeal process is still pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Then ICTA gave the same decision with the Regional Directorate gave before and imposed an
	administrative fine to the Company in the amount of TL 2,057 again pursuant to the regulations in force in the relevant time by its decision which was notified to the Company on 5&nbsp;December 2012. The Company filed a lawsuit for stay of execution
	and for the annulment of the decision. The Court rejected the Company&#146;s request. The Company objected to the decision. The objection was also rejected. The Court accepted the lawsuit in favor of the Company. ICTA appealed the decision. The
	Company replied the appeal request. The Council of State approved the first instance court&#146;s decision. The ICTA applied for the correction of the decision. The Council of State rejected ICTA&#146;s correction of the decision request, in favor
	of the Company. Since therefore, the first instance court decision is finalized on September&nbsp;3,2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine
	was paid within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and TL 1,542 was paid on 3&nbsp;January 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA reimbursed the relative amount to Turkcell on 2&nbsp;July 2014 with respect to the Court decision.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA on invoicing mistakes
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA pursued an investigation to examine the subscribers&#146; complaints which are about the Company&#146;s invoicing mistakes. On-site
	investigations have been commenced between 14-17&nbsp;January and 15-16&nbsp;May 2014. The inquiry of investigation which includes the findings of the investigation was delivered to the Company on 2&nbsp;June 2014. On 2&nbsp;July 2014 the Company
	filed its written defenses to ICTA. An oral hearing was held before the ICTA Board on 31&nbsp;October 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA, by its decision dated
	31&nbsp;October 2014 took upon the aforementioned investigation, decided to issue an official warning to the Company as regards to the allegation that the Company misinformed the subscribers regarding one of its Tariff Package; moreover, ICTA
	imposed an administrative fine of TL&nbsp;1,213 in total, with respect to its allegations that the Company violated its obligations related to correct invoicing and also violated its obligations related to the consumer rights and the obligations
	arisen out of its authorization; furthermore, ICTA decided that the reimbursements (stipulated to be made to the subscribers due to the infringements, which were alleged that occur within the scope of the aforementioned Board Decision) should be
	finalized within 6 six month. The Company filed 8 separate lawsuits for the cancellation of the aforementioned decision on 15&nbsp;January 2015. The Court rejected the Company&#146;s stay of
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-131
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage276"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	execution request, made on the lawsuit, which was filed for the cancellation of the Article 8 of the aforementioned Board Decision. The Company objected to this decision. Objection was rejected.
	All of the cases are pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine amounting to TL 1,213 was paid within 1 month following the notification of
	the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and payment amounting to TL 910 was made on 7&nbsp;January 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the consolidated
	financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015, no provision is recognized for the expected reimbursement to subscribers (31 December 2014: TL 2,957).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA on limited usage services
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA initiated an investigation in order to determine whether the Company is in compliance with the regulations on limited usage services. The
	ICTA Board decided that the Company&#146;s practices are incompatible with the ICTA regulations and imposed an administrative fine of TL 18,539 to the Company. The Board also obliged the Company to make a reimbursement amounting TL 37,184 to the
	subscribers within six months.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine amounting to TL 18,539 was paid within 1 month following the notification of
	the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and payment amounting to TL 13,905 was made on 31&nbsp;January 2014. The Company filed a lawsuit on 4&nbsp;February 2014 for the stay of execution and the cancellation of the aforementioned act and
	decision. The Court rejected the stay of execution request of the Company. The Company objected to this decision. District Administrative Court rejected the objection. The case is pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015, no provision is recognized for the expected
	reimbursement to subscribers (31 December 2014: TL 10,047).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA about Processing Personal Data
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA commenced an investigation in order to determine whether Company is in compliance with the regulations on &#147;Processing Personal Data
	and Protecting of Secrecy&#148;. As a result of the investigation ICTA decided to impose an administrative fine to the Company on 16&nbsp;January 2014, amounting to TL 1,413. The Company filed a lawsuit on 28&nbsp;March 2014 for the stay of
	execution and the cancellation of the aforementioned decision. The Court rejected the stay of execution request of the Company. The Company objected to this decision. Objection was rejected. The Company requested stay of execution again. The Court
	rejected the stay of execution request of the Company again. The Company objected to this decision. Objection was rejected. The case is still pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine was paid within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, and 25% discount was applied and
	payment amounting to TL 1,059 was made on 7&nbsp;March 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Administrative fine imposed by the ICTA regarding the number of
	subscribers and radio utilization and usage fees of 2010-2011
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA commenced an investigation, against the GSM operators, on the
	accuracy of the subscription numbers reports of 2010 and 2011 which is essential for the payment of radio utilization and usage fee, and on-site investigations have been commenced.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-132
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage277"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The inquiry of investigation which includes the findings of the investigation was delivered
	to the Company on 31&nbsp;July 2013. The inquiry claims that the Company paid less radio utilization and usage fees amounting to TL 67,493 than it was required for the years 2010 and 2011, and an administrative fine should be imposed. On
	2&nbsp;September 2013 the Company filed its written defense, and an oral hearing was held before the ICTA Board on 11&nbsp;December 2013 to submit the Company&#146;s further comments. ICTA issued an official warning to the Company for the amount of
	TL 4,512 regarding the radio utilization and usage fee which the Company allegedly did not pay for the years 2010-2011. In addition, ICTA imposed an administrative fine to the Company amounting to TL 2,648 for the amount of TL 62,399 of radio
	utilization and usage fee which the Company allegedly did not pay for the year 2010-2011 and to initiate an in-depth investigation to further inspect the correctness of the radio utilization and usage fee payments regarding terms do not fall under
	the scope of this investigation. The Company filed a lawsuit on 28&nbsp;April 2014 for the cancellation of the aforementioned decision. The case is still pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine was paid within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and payment
	amounting to TL 1,986 was made on 16&nbsp;April 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA sent notifications to the Company dated 27&nbsp;May 2014 and 26&nbsp;June 2014
	and by these notifications, ICTA demanded the Company to pay the radio utilization and usage fees amounting to TL 67,493; the amount which the Company allegedly paid deficiently on ICTA&#146;s decision took upon the aforementioned investigation on
	the radio utilization and usage fees regarding the term 2010-2011. After that, ICTA send another notification to the Company on 24&nbsp;July 2014 and notify the Company that it deducted the Company&#146;s claims which the Company entitled to collect
	by sharing its antenna facilities. The Company filed a lawsuit on 5&nbsp;September 2014 for the cancellation of these 3 administrative acts. Moreover, the Company also requested the Court to recourse to Constitutional Court for the cancellation of
	the 1
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	st
</SUP>
	, 3
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	rd
</SUP>
	and 5
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	paragraphs of the
	46
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	article of the Code numbered 5809 by this lawsuit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA filed a lawsuit against
	the Company on 13&nbsp;October 2014 for the collection of TL 40,885 the amount which ICTA alleged that the Company paid deficiently by its Board decision, took upon the investigation on the radio utilization and usage fees regarding the term
	2010-2011 with its accrued interest. The Court decided to obtain an expert report, regarding the respective case. The case is still pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the management opinion, the probability of an outflow of resources embodying economic benefits to settle the obligation regarding the
	additional utilization and usage fees request amounting to TL 67,493 is not probable, thus, no provision is recognized in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA, imposed an administrative act on the Company by referring to its Board Decision took upon the investigation on the radio utilization and
	usage fees regarding the period 2010-2011 and alleged that the Company has also paid the radio utilization and usage fees deficiently in the amount of TL 1,257, during the term 2013&nbsp;July-December and by this administrative act, send accrual
	slips so as to collect the respective amount. The Company filed a lawsuit on 8&nbsp;September 2014 for the cancellation of ICTA&#146;s aforementioned accrual slips and administrative act, implied on the Company. The Company also requested the Court
	to recourse to Constitutional Court for the cancellation of the 1
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	st
</SUP>
	, 3
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	rd
</SUP>
	and 5
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	paragraphs of the 46
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	article of the Code numbered 5809. The case is still pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Due to the fact that the Company did not pay TL 1,257, the amount which was alleged that the Company paid deficiently during the term
	2013&nbsp;July-December, ICTA filed a lawsuit on 23&nbsp;December 2014 for the collection of the aforementioned amount with its accrued interest, which will be calculated according to Code numbered 6183. The Court decided to consolidate this lawsuit
	with the lawsuit filed by ICTA on 13&nbsp;October 2014. The cases are pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-133
</P>

	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the management opinion, the probability of an outflow of resources embodying
	economic benefits is uncertain, thus, no provision is recognized in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA on subscription numbers and radio utilization and usage fees of 2012
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA commenced an on-site investigations, against the GSM operators, on the accuracy of the subscriber numbers report of 2012 which is
	essential for radio utilization and usage fees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As a result of the investigation, ICTA imposed an administrative fine to the Company
	amounting to TL&nbsp;2,802 for the amount of TL 43,736 of radio utilization and usage fee which the Company allegedly did not pay for the year 2012.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine was paid within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and payment
	amounting to TL 2,101 was made on 11&nbsp;September 2014. The Company filed a lawsuit on 2&nbsp;October 2014 for the cancellation of the aforementioned Board Decision. The Company also requested the Court to recourse to Constitutional Court for the
	cancellation of the 1st, 3rd and 5th paragraphs of the 46th article of the Code numbered 5809 by this lawsuit. The case is pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	Company filed a lawsuit on 24&nbsp;November 2014 for the cancellation of ICTA&#146;s administrative acts implied on the Company for the collection of the radio utilization and usage fees in the amount of TL 43,519 which was claimed to have been paid
	deficiently on the aforementioned administrative act. The Company also requested the Court to recourse to Constitutional Court for the cancellation of the 1st, 3rd and 5th paragraphs of the 46th article of the Code numbered 5809 by this lawsuit. The
	case is pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA filed a lawsuit on 3&nbsp;March 2015 for the collection of TL 43,519. The amount which was alleged that the Company
	paid deficiently by the ICTA decision took upon the investigation on the radio utilization and usage fees, regarding the year 2012 with its accrued interest, which will be calculated. The Court decided to take an expert report. The case is pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the management opinion, the probability of an outflow of resources embodying economic benefits to settle the obligation regarding
	the additional utilization and usage fees request amounting to TL 43,736 is not probable, thus, no provision is recognized in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	In-depth investigation initiated by ICTA regarding the number of subscribers and radio utilization and usage fees of 2004-2009
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA commenced an in-depth investigation regarding the term 2004-2009 years, against the GSM operators, on the accuracy of the subscription
	numbers&#146; reports, which are the essential for the payment of radio utilization and usage fees. As a result of the investigation, ICTA imposed an administrative fine to the Company amounting to TL 2,802 with the allegation that during 2006-2009
	years the radio utilization and usage fees which Turkcell&#146;s subscribers should pay were paid deficient.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine
	was paid within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and payment amounting to TL 2,101 was.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company filed two separate lawsuits for the cancellation of the respective parts of the aforementioned Board Decision and the respective
	administrative acts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-134
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the meantime, ICTA, based on the aforementioned Board decision, notified the Company that
	Turkcell caused both deficient payment and also overpayment of the radio utilization and usage fees from the radio utilization and usage fees that shall be paid on October-December 2005. Therefore, ICTA deducted the amounts that were alleged to have
	been paid deficiently with their accrued delay penalty; from Turkcell&#146;s overpaid amounts. Moreover, by this administrative act, ICTA notified the Company that after this deduction, ICTA recorded the remaining Turkcell&#146;s receivables, in the
	amount of TL 13,310 into its accounts. Turkcell filed a lawsuit for the cancellation of this administrative act and the accrual slips sent by this administrative act.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Furthermore, demanded Turkcell to pay the radio utilization and usage fees in the amount of TL 110,722 with its accrued delay penalty, which is
	alleged to have been paid deficiently during the years 2006-2009 and notified the Company that it may deduct the overpaid radio utilization and usage fees in the amount of TL 73,200. The Company filed a lawsuit for the cancellation of the
	aforementioned administrative act. The cases are pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the management opinion, the probability of an outflow of resources
	embodying economic benefits to settle the obligation is not probable, thus, no provision is recognized in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA on ICTA Board Decision No: 149
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA carried out an investigation whether the Company is compliant with ICTA Board decision number 149 and related decisions, which set a
	minimum rate for the Company&#146;s on-net prices and an obligation to report the actual prices for tariffs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As a result of the
	investigation ICTA imposed an administrative fine of TL 4,061 to the Company, for not complying with its reporting obligation set by the aforementioned ICTA decision, by submitting false and misleading reports and information to the ICTA and for not
	keeping the necessary information regarding the investigation during the term of the investigation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine was paid
	within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and payment amounting to TL 3,046 was made on 1&nbsp;April 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company filed 3 separate lawsuits for the stay of execution and the cancellation of the related articles of the aforementioned decision.
	The Court rejected the stay of execution requests. The Company objected these decisions. Objections were rejected. The cases are pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Tax Penalty as a result of tax investigation regarding deduction of stamp duty calculation of the year 2009
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Istanbul Large Taxpayers Group Presidency of Tax Inspection Board inspected year 2009 stamp duty in accordance with its limited stamp duty
	review and issued a report on incorrect stamp duty rates applied for some rent agreements. The Company paid a total of TL 2,918 on 28&nbsp;November 2015 for stamp duty and loss of tax as a result of the compromise on 29&nbsp;September 2015 and
	recognized as expense in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation
	initiated by Competition Authority for Exclusive Agreements for the base station areas
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The decision of the Competition Board based on
	a preliminary investigation dated 22&nbsp;April 2009, on which there are no findings of an infringement of competition rules, regarding the Company&#146;s exclusive
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-135
</P>

<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	agreements for the areas where base stations are erected, was cancelled by the Council of State. Accordingly, the Competition Board decided to initiate an investigation regarding the issue. The
	notification of the investigation has been received by the Company on 16&nbsp;August 2013. The Company has submitted its first written defense and additional information requested within due dates. Competition Board decided to extend investigation
	period for additional 2 months. The report regarding the investigation and additional report has been sent to the Company. Written defenses were submitted within due date. The Competition Authority Board decided that the Company&#146;s practices did
	not cause any infringement under the Law number 4054.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the management opinion, the probability of an outflow of resources
	embodying economic benefits to settle the obligation regarding the additional utilization and usage fees request is uncertain, thus, no provision is recognized in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December
	2015 (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Cancellation of the administrative acts and accrual slips regarding the TRX Radio Utilization fees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company filed a lawsuit on September&nbsp;2, 2014; for the stay of execution and the cancellation of ICTA&#146;s administrative
	acts and the accrual slips regarding the TRX Radio Utilization Fees, amounting to TL 1,418. Since ICTA ordered the Company to re-pay the radio utilization fees for the TRXs that are relocated so that the Company had to pay the radio utilization fees
	retrospectively for the same TRXs in the same year, due to these aforementioned administrative acts. Respective court case is separated into two cases. In the case, filed for the stay of execution and the cancellation of the accrual slips, the Court
	rejected the Company&#146;s stay of execution request. The Company objected to this decision. The objection is rejected. The Company requested stay of execution again.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company also filed a lawsuit for the stay of execution and the cancelation of the &#147;TRX Notification Form&#148; and the term placed in
	the &#147;Additional TRX&#148; definition (defined in the Explanation Guide to the respective Form) stating that &#147;&#133;of the new base station that is mounted, independently from the base station that is demounted in the same year&#133;&#148;.
	The Council of State accepted the Company&#146;s stay of execution request.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On the other hand, ICTA cancelled some of the aforementioned
	accrual slips and prepared new accrual slips in the amount of TL 395 instead of the cancelled ones. The Company filed a lawsuit on 2&nbsp;March 2015; for the cancellation of the respective new accrual slips and the administrative act regarding the
	notification of these accrual slips. The case is pending.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the management opinion, the probability of an outflow of resources
	embodying economic benefits to settle the obligation regarding the additional utilization and usage fees request is uncertain, thus, no provision is recognized in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December
	2015 (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA on open lines
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA initiated an investigation about the Company&#146;s compliance with open lines and unit/minute frauds regulations. On-site investigations
	have been commenced on 18-20&nbsp;August 2014. The inquiry of investigation which includes the findings of the investigation was delivered to the Company on 22&nbsp;October 2014. The Company&#146;s written defenses was submitted within due date. The
	oral hearing was held before the ICTA Board on 27&nbsp;May 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-136
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As a result of the investigation ICTA imposed an administrative fine amounting to TL 3,082 in
	total for five separate violations by its decision dated 9&nbsp;July 2015. The Company applied to ICTA to retrieve its aforementioned Board decision. ICTA implicitly rejected this application. The Company filed five separate lawsuits for the
	cancellation of the respective Board decision and implicit rejection.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine was paid within 1 month following the
	notification of the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and payment amounting to TL 2,311 was made on 2&nbsp;December 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA on processing of personal data
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA initiated an investigation about the Company&#146;s compliance with the regulations of processing personal data, withdrawal cost
	calculations, target messaging, smart advertising. On-site investigations have been commenced on 22-24&nbsp;January 2014 and 16-18&nbsp;April 2014. The inquiry of investigation which includes the three violation findings of the investigation was
	delivered to the Company on 4&nbsp;November 2014. The Company&#146;s written defenses was submitted within due date. The oral hearing was held on 28&nbsp;July 2015 before the ICTA Board. As a result of the investigation ICTA issued a legal warning
	to the Company and also imposed separate administrative fines in the amount of TL 2,801 in total by its decision dated 29&nbsp;July 2015. Besides ICTA requested the Company to reimburse the overcharged amounts to the subscribers and to complete
	reimbursements within 4 months. Moreover, if there be any other overcharged amount recognized between the inspection date and the date of notification of the decision have been also requested to be reimbursed within 6 months. The Company applied to
	ICTA to retrieve its aforementioned Board decision. ICTA implicitly rejected this application. The Company filed three separate lawsuits for the cancellation of the aforementioned Board decision&#146;s respective articles and the implicit rejection.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the administrative fine was paid within 1 month following the notification of the decision of ICTA, 25% discount was applied and
	payment amounting to TL 2,101 was made on 30&nbsp;November 2015. In the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015, no provision is recognized for the expected reimbursement to subscribers (31 December
	2014: TL 5,408).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA regarding Invoice Upper Limit
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA initiated an investigation about invoice upper limit regulations which is about; informing subscribers during international mobile data
	roaming, overcharging subscribers during the change of some tariffs and misinforming some subscribers. On-site investigation has been commenced on 14-16&nbsp;October 2014 and inquiry of investigation which includes claims of the investigation was
	delivered to the Company on 25&nbsp;February 2015. The inquiry also states that the Company didn&#146;t send the mandatory messages to the subscribers in most of the cases thus some subscribers were overcharged in the amount of TL 7,170. As a result
	of the investigation ICTA imposed three separate administrative fines totaling to 1,016 TL by its decision dated 23&nbsp;November 2015. By its aforementioned decision, ICTA also alleged that the Company overcharged its subscribers by TL 6,181 and it
	should reimburse these amounts to the subscribers within 6 months.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company filed 3 separate lawsuits for the cancellation of the
	respective articles of the aforementioned Board decision.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended
	31&nbsp;December 2015, provisions amounting to TL 762 for administrative fines which was imposed by ICTA and TL 3,517 are recognized for the expected reimbursement to subscribers, respectively (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-137

	ICTA&#146;s respective decision, 25% discount was applied and payment amounting to TL 762 was made on 23&nbsp;February 2016.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA regarding the number of subscribers and radio utilization and usage fees of 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA commenced an investigation on the accuracy of the subscription numbers reports of 2013 which is essential for the payment of radio
	utilization and usage fee. The inquiry of investigation claims that the Company paid less radio utilization and usage fees total amounting to TL 21,191 and an administrative fine should be imposed. The Company&#146;s written defense was submitted
	within due date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the management opinion, the probability of an outflow of resources embodying economic benefits to settle the
	obligation regarding the additional utilization and usage fees request is uncertain, thus, no provision is recognized in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA on termination of subscription
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA initiated an in investigation about the Company&#146;s compliance with the regulations about subscribers&#146; termination demands. As a
	result of the investigation ICTA decided to issue an official warning to the Company for one violation, for two violations ICTA imposed amounting to TL 3,082 for administrative fines. In addition, The Board also obliged the Company to make a
	reimbursement amounting TL 2,043 to the subscribers within three months. Reimbursement procedure, which should be made to the subscribers, was also started before ICTA decision thus in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period
	ended 31&nbsp;December 2015, no provision is recognized for the amount which has not been reimbursed to the subscribers.In the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015, provision amounting to TL 2,311
	for administrative fines which was imposed by ICTA. (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Investigation initiated by ICTA on TRX Radio Utilization
	Fees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ICTA commenced an investigation on the correctness of notifications about TRX channels which are essential for the radio
	utilization and usage fees, made to ICTA by the Company in 2011 and before. The inquiry claims that the Company paid less radio usage fees than it was required for the years 2005-2011, and besides an administrative fine should be imposed. The
	Company&#146;s written defense was submitted within due date. After submitting the written defense ICTA commenced a supplemental on-site investigation on
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	14-17&nbsp;September
</FONT>
	2015 and afterwards a new inquiry
	was delivered to the Company. The inquiry claims that the Company paid less radio usage fee total amounting to TL 8,782 than it was required for the years 2005-2011, and besides an administrative fine should be imposed. The Company&#146;s written
	defense will be submitted within due date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the management opinion, the probability of an outflow of resources embodying economic
	benefits to settle the obligation regarding the additional utilization and usage fees request is uncertain, thus, no provision is recognized in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December
	2014: None).
</P>

	financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: None).

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Commitments and Contingencies
	related to Inteltek
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Disputes with Spor Toto
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Permission request made to Spor Toto regarding the change of Inteltek&#146;s shareholder structure
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Intralot Integrated Lottery Systems&nbsp;&amp; Services (&#147;Intralot SA&#148;), one of the shareholders of Inteltek, notified Inteltek
	regarding the plan of share transfer and merger transactions in Intralot group. Inteltek requested a written permission from Spor Toto Directorate on 30&nbsp;January 2013 within the frame of Article 18/2 of &#147;Agreement on Assigning Fixed Odds
	and Joint Betting Games Based on Sports Competition to Legal Persons described on Private Law&#148; dated 29&nbsp;August 2008 and signed between Inteltek and Spor Toto. As a result of the &#147;implied rejection&#148; of Inteltek&#146;s permission
	request by Spor Toto, Inteltek filed a lawsuit for the cancellation and the stay of execution of this implied rejection. The Court has decided to reject the lawsuit because of the lack of competence. Inteltek appealed the decision. The 13th Council
	of State has decided to accept Inteltek&#146;s appeal request and reversed the decision of the Administrative Court. The defendant applied for correction of decision. It has been replied to the request for correction of decision within its legal
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-139
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage284"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	term by Inteltek. The Council of State decided to reject the request for correction of decision. The lawsuit file has been sent to its Court of First Instance. The defendant has objected on
	competence. The court rejected the competence objection and decided to evaluate the motion for stay of execution following the completion of the term for competence. The defendant claimed on competence. Our Company replied to this claim within its
	legal term. The case file is at Court Of Jurisdictional Disputes for the determination of the competence.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Commitments and
	Contingencies related to Astelit
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Astelit 3G Agreement
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In March 2015, Astelit received 3G license amounting to UAH 3,355,400 (equivalent to TL406,495 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) . According to 3G
	License terms, license is covering all 27 Ukrainian regions. It is taken for 30 MHz range in 1920-1935 and 2110-2125 band and is valid for 15 years. 3G license obligations include: to ensure quality of 3G service in regional centers within 18
	months, to ensure quality of 3G service in all settlements with population more than 10,000 within 2-6 years and to finance conversion of spectrum from military use.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Dispute of Astelit with its distributor
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	One of Astelit&#146;s distributors filed a lawsuit against Astelit claiming a compensation in the amount of UAH 106,443 (equivalent to TL12,895
	as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) which is allegedly the sum of advance payment for undelivered goods. According to the commission agreement, signed between parties, the payment terms are 30 days after delivery date (net of distributor&#146;s
	commission). The distributor violated the conditions of agreement and did not pay on time. Therefore, Astelit made a counterclaim for the recovery of indebtedness in the amount of UAH 35,292 (equivalent to TL4,276 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dispute passed through all the instances twice. On 26&nbsp;March 2012, the High Commercial Court of Ukraine approved the previous positive
	decision for Astelit counterclaim.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Enforcement document was submitted to the State Enforcement Service. According to Ukrainian
	legislation, the distributor has a right to appeal the decision before Supreme Court of Ukraine within three months from the date of judgment of the High Commercial Court of Ukraine but the distributor did not use the right.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The distributor had a statute of limitation for 3 years from the date of the High Commercial Court decision, which expired on 26&nbsp;March
	2015. The distributor is not conducting economic activity for a long period of time and has not appealed the decision. The possibility of such actions from distributor is lost.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the management decision, the probability of an outflow of resources embodying economic benefits to settle the obligation is uncertain,
	thus, no provision is recognized in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: None).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Dispute of Astelit related to withholding tax on interest expense
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Ukrainian Tax Administration sent a tax notice to Astelit stating that withholding tax rate on interest expense for the loan agreement with
	Euroasia should be 10% for the year 2009. According to Ukrainian legislation and Convention on avoiding double taxation between Ukraine and the Netherlands, Astelit paid withholding tax at 2%. Astelit filed a suit to cancel tax notice, which imposed
	Astelit to pay additional UAH 11,651 (equivalent to TL1,411 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015). The High Administrative Court decided in favor of
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-140
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage285"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D135598D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	TURKCELL ILETISIM HIZMETLERI AS AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#151;(Continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	As at and for the year ended 31 December 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	(Amounts expressed in thousands of Turkish Liras unless otherwise indicated except share amounts)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Tax Administration on 27&nbsp;March 2014. Therefore, Astelit paid the aforementioned amount on 4&nbsp;April 2014. Also, additional penalty based on 120% of NBU&#146;s daily rate will be paid to
	the Tax Authority according to the court decision. The court has decided that Euroasia status as financial institution must be defined under Ukrainian law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On 27&nbsp;June 2014, Astelit filed an application to the Supreme Court for review of abovementioned decision and proof that Dutch legislation
	should be applied. On 14&nbsp;July 2014, the High Administrative Court applied Astelit&#146;s admission for review in Supreme Court.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On
	2&nbsp;December 2014, the Supreme Court has rejected Astelit`s appeal completely. The initial tax decision regarding additional withholding tax paid (UAH 11,651) (equivalent to TL1,411 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) and Euroasia qualification as
	nonfinancial institution remain in force.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on negative court decision, Ukrainian Tax Authority invited Astelit&#146;s representatives
	to the meeting and proposed to pay voluntarily the difference of withholding tax up to 10% and 3% of tax fine for the period of 2011-2012. Astelit paid this difference amounting to UAH 4,105 (equivalent to TL497 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) in
	December 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On 26&nbsp;March 2015, Astelit lodged an application to the Supreme Court for review of abovementioned decision and proof
	that Dutch legislation should be applied. On 30&nbsp;March 2015, Supreme Court of Ukraine dismissed Astelit&#146;s claim.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the
	management opinion, provision amounting to UAH 4,806 (equivalent to TL582 as at 31&nbsp;December 2015) has been set for the penalty risks belonging to years 2009, 2010, 2011 and 2012 in the consolidated financial statements as at and for the period
	ended 31&nbsp;December 2015 (31 December 2014: TL707).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Commitments and Contingencies related to Superonline
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Order of payment notified to Turkcell Superonline according to universal service fund
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On 24&nbsp;October 2011, Beykoz Tax Administration notified Turkcell Superonline with an order of payment amounting to TL 1,192 for
	insufficient payments made by Turkcell Superonline for universal service fund related to years of 2005, 2006, 2007 and 2008. Four legal cases have been filed as of 31&nbsp;October 2011 to revoke payment orders. Based on the management decision, TL
	1,203 was paid on 7&nbsp;December 2011 with its accrued interest. On 21&nbsp;December 2011, based on the scope of Share Purchase Agreement, Turkcell Superonline sent a notice in order to receive payment from Demir Toprak Ith.Ihr. ve Tic. AS,
	S&#105;nai ve Mali Yatirimlar Holding AS and Endustri Holding AS. Any payment has not been received as of 31&nbsp;December 2015. Said payment shall be reimbursed in case of execution of suspension or the Court&#146;s decision in favor of Turkcell
	Superonline. On 28&nbsp;November 2012, two of the said order of payments, each amounting to TL&nbsp;330 and TL 450 have been cancelled in favor of Turkcell Superonline which were notified on 23&nbsp;January 2013 and 28&nbsp;January 2013,
	respectively. The said cancellation decisions are appealed by Beykoz Tax Administration but this application was rejected, decisions are approved. Turkcell Superonline filed two lawsuits for repayment of TL 410 and TL 558. After the full remedy
	action lawsuits for repayment, Communication General Directorate which related to Ministry of Communications paid TL 330 in regard to universal service fund for the year 2005 and TL 449 in regard to universal service fund for the year 2006 to
	Turkcell Superonline on 17&nbsp;June 2015. Because of the insufficient amount paid for the lawsuits which we claimed other than principal that TL 80 interest for the year 2005 and TL 109 interest for the year 2006. The Company continue both lawsuits
	for these insufficient amounts. The other two cases were rejected by the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-141
</P>
